analyzed: yid la zhe sdang yod pa'i gnyen po nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de zil gyis mnan pa ni de'i gnyen po bzod ba la brten pas so //

translated: “One becomes endowed with the fortune of happiness” means

analyzed: mtho ris 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One goes to heaven” means

original: 'jig rten pha rol du bde ba 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du bde ba 'thob pa yin te /
translated: obtaining happiness in the next world.

original: de bas na skyon 'di med pa yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na skyon 'di med pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since this fault does not exist,

analyzed: bzod pa bsten na de dag gi mthu nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: 'jig rten la phan par byed pa ste /

translated: Because a Brahmin is a field of good qualities.

original: 'chi ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal can zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la mya ngan byed mod /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal can zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la mya ngan byed mod /
translated: He is one who suffers from the suffering of death and disease, and the condensed meaning of this is: he is one who suffers from the defilement of birth, the defilement of karma, and the defilement of the afflictions.

original: ga la khro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ga la khro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Where is there anger?

original: 'chi ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya bas ni /
translated: By saying the suffering of death and disease, he is one who suffers from the suffering of suffering.🔽 By saying the suffering of change, he is one who suffers from the suffering of change.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The defilement of birth is shown by the defilement of birth.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang dbang du gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang dbang du gyur //
translated: He is under the sway of attachment and aversion

original: zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: shows the defilement of defilement.

original: nyes par spyod pas tshig pa la //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pas tshig pa la //
translated: He is burned by misconduct🔽shows the defilement of action.🔽He is burned by the maturation of his actions

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to //🔽bdag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du bstan to // bdag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: shows the defilement of maturation.

original: de la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni ma yin no //
translated: He is burned by the maturation of his actions, but not by the maturation of the actions of others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: To establish that, he says:

original: bde ba can la sdug bsngal rjes 'brang ba //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'og ma smos so //
analyzed: bde ba can la sdug bsngal rjes 'brang ba // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'og ma smos so //
translated: He is followed by suffering in the happy states.

original: skyob par ma nus pa zhes bya ba ni las bdag gir bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyob par ma nus pa zhes bya ba ni las bdag gir bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not able to protect himself means that he is not able to protect himself from the maturation of his own actions.

original: rgyal po grongs na'ang zhes bya ba ni rgyal po nyi tsher ma zad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal po grongs na'ang zhes bya ba ni rgyal po nyi tsher ma zad de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if the king dies means that it is not only the king who is subject to this.

original: skyes na zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes na zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is birth means if there is the existence of birth.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na sdug bsngal yod ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na sdug bsngal yod ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means because if there is birth, there is suffering.

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because birth is the root of suffering.

original: skye ba nyid la 'khon du gzung ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: skye ba nyid la 'khon du gzung ba'i rigs te /
translated: It is proper to hold a grudge against birth itself.

original: skye ba med na sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med na sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no birth, there is no suffering.

original: skye ba yod na ni sdug bsngal myong ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yod na ni sdug bsngal myong ba yin te /
translated: If there is birth, there is the experience of suffering.

original: bzod pa mi byed pa ma yin pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bzod pa mi byed pa ma yin pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to the cause of not being patient,

original: nags na gnas shing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: nags na gnas shing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: he says the verse, Dwelling in the forest.

original: nags na gnas zhes bya bas ni yongs su bzung ba thams cad spangs par ston to //
analyzed: nags na gnas zhes bya bas ni yongs su bzung ba thams cad spangs par ston to //
translated: Dwelling in the forest shows the abandonment of all possessions.

original: rab tu 'byung bar shes zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa la dam bcas pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar shes zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa la dam bcas pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The expression, I will go forth, shows the vow of patience.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'i stobs yod pa'i phyir dang / bzod pa smra la zhes gzhan dag la bzod pa'i man ngag ston pa nyid de /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'i stobs yod pa'i phyir dang / bzod pa smra la zhes gzhan dag la bzod pa'i man ngag ston pa nyid de /
translated: Because the renunciate has the power of patience, and because he teaches the instruction in patience to others, as it is said, “the patient teacher.”

original: 'di gnyis kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'o //
translated: These two verses show that the renunciate is patient.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas kyang mi bzod pa'i rnam pa med par ston to //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas kyang mi bzod pa'i rnam pa med par ston to //
translated: And he shows that he is without the aspect of impatience by means of shame and dread of blame.

original: ring por mi thogs 'chi zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: ring por mi thogs 'chi zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: “Death is not far off” shows

original: 'jig rten pha rol dang nye ba nyid pas mi bzod pa'i @314b 'bras bu'i rkyen byung bar nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dang nye ba nyid pas mi bzod pa'i @314b 'bras bu'i rkyen byung bar nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that the condition for the result of impatience is near, because the next world is near.

original: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las bzod par smra ba'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las bzod par smra ba'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This completes the Jataka of Kṣāntivādin, the twentieth of the Auspicious Hundred, from the “Tales of the Elders.”

original: // / kha na ma tho ba ni rab tu smad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: // / kha na ma tho ba ni rab tu smad par bya ba'o //
translated: Blame is the state of being despised.

original: yul gyi bde ba tsam gyi tshod kyis kyang //
analyzed: yul gyi bde ba tsam gyi tshod kyis kyang //
translated: “Even for the sake of a mere worldly pleasure”

original: zhes bya bas ni ngan don tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ngan don tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: shows that it is a small matter.

original: yul gyi bde ba ni bsags pa dang / bsrung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mong bo'i dben du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gyi bde ba ni bsags pa dang / bsrung ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mong bo'i dben du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The pleasures of objects are isolated from the many sufferings of accumulating and guarding wealth.🔽

original: yul gyi bde ba tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyi bde ba tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: The pleasure of objects is called mere pleasure of objects because it is isolated from the many sufferings of acquiring and protecting them.

original: 'jig rten rnams ni bag med dbang du gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams ni bag med dbang du gyur //
translated: The world is under the sway of heedlessness,

original: ces bya ba ni rang gi bde ba yang mi sgrub pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang gi bde ba yang mi sgrub pas so //
translated: because it does not even seek its own pleasure.🔽Even with the pleasure of the meditative absorptions,

original: bsam gtan bde pas kyang zhes bya bas kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa des kyang ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan bde pas kyang zhes bya bas kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa des kyang ngo //
translated: even with that superior pleasure of the meditative absorptions,

original: de'i khyad par du 'phags pa des ni cig shos rnam par bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par du 'phags pa des ni cig shos rnam par bcad pa yin te /
translated: it is excluded by that superior pleasure of the meditative absorptions,

original: bsags pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mthar yang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang na gnod sems mang ba'i khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba mang ba'i khams dang / 'dod pa mang pa'i khams de ni /
analyzed: bsags pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mthar yang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro // gang na gnod sems mang ba'i khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba mang ba'i khams dang / 'dod pa mang pa'i khams de ni /
translated: because it is free from the faults of acquisition, etc., and because it is the cause for going to a happy rebirth in the end.🔽That realm where malice is abundant, that realm where violence is abundant, that realm where desire is abundant,

original: gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba mang ba 'dod pa'i khams te /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba mang ba 'dod pa'i khams te /
translated: that realm of desire is abundant in malice and violence.

original: de la bltas na'o //
analyzed: de la bltas na'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bshes gnyen ngan pa la brten pa'i skyon gyis zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bshes gnyen ngan pa la brten pa'i skyon gyis zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase “due to the fault of relying on a bad friend”

original: gzhan gyi sgra'i dring la 'jog par bstan to ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i dring la 'jog par bstan to ;
translated: teaches that one is led by the words of another.🔽The phrase “due to the habit of attending to what is unreal”

original: / yang dag pa ma yin pa yid la byed pa la 'dris pas zhes bya bas ni skyon tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid ston to //🔽log par lta ba stug po'i zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba yongs su ma brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / yang dag pa ma yin pa yid la byed pa la 'dris pas zhes bya bas ni skyon tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid ston to // log par lta ba stug po'i zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba yongs su ma brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: teaches that the fault is the improper attention itself.🔽The phrase “due to the thicket of wrong views”

original: gnyi ga'i rkyen can nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rkyen can nyid du bstan to //
translated: teaches that both are conditioned by wrong views, because of the lack of thorough analysis of wrong views.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
translated: The ripening of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi bla na med pa'i phyir /🔽dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi bla na med pa'i phyir / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ga la yod de /
translated: is not found in the world beyond,

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no world beyond.

original: chos la spyod pa'i spro ba med pa gang yin pa de ni de'o //
analyzed: chos la spyod pa'i spro ba med pa gang yin pa de ni de'o //
translated: The lack of enthusiasm for practicing the Dharma is that.

original: 'di ni lha khang dang / gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang ; rdzing bu la sogs pa byed pa'i spro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha khang dang / gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang ; rdzing bu la sogs pa byed pa'i spro ba med pa'o //
translated: He has no interest in building temples, monasteries, parks, ponds, and so on.

original: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid chos yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid chos yin te /
translated: Or else, generosity and so on are the Dharma.

original: de dag gis bsam pa las ldog pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis bsam pa las ldog pa nyid du ston to //
translated: It shows that he turns away from the intention to do them.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa gang yin pa de ni /🔽sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i @315a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa gang yin pa de ni / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i @315a * //
translated: Whatever is good conduct, such as generosity and morality,

original: legs par spyad pa ste /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa ste /
translated: is the Dharma.

original: de sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: He turns away from the practice of that.

original: 'dis ni spyin pa la sogs par sbyor ba'i byed pa dang bral ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyin pa la sogs par sbyor ba'i byed pa dang bral ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is free from the activity of applying himself to generosity and so on.

original: ci'i phyir de de ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de de ltar gnas she na /
translated: Why does he remain in that way?

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dge dang mi dge'i las las zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so ;
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir / dge dang mi dge'i las las zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so ;
translated: In order to show the cause of that, he says:🔽From virtuous and nonvirtuous actions,

original: / dge ba'i las las ni bde ba bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / dge ba'i las las ni bde ba bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: Ten kinds of happiness arise from virtuous actions.

original: mi dge ba'i las las ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las las ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Suffering arises from nonvirtuous karma.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol nyid du bstan to //
translated: The word “other” indicates the next world.

original: sdig pa spangs te zhes bya ba sdig pas ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdig pa spangs te zhes bya ba sdig pas ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Having abandoned evil” means having abandoned evil because suffering arises from evil.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Suffering arises because it is undesirable.

original: dge ba'i gnas la rab tu 'bad pa ni bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas la rab tu 'bad pa ni bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Exerting oneself in virtue” means that happiness arises because happiness arises from virtue.

original: bde ba ni 'dod pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'dod pa nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Happiness arises because it is desirable.

original: dad pa med pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dad pa med pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “Those without faith” are those who lack faith in virtue and so on.

original: ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ba ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur ba ni bdag nyid do //
translated: “They will fall into the lower realms” means that they will fall into the lower realms.

original: bdag nyid gcig pur ma zad de /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pur ma zad de /
translated: Not only do they themselves fall into the lower realms,

original: de bzhin du 'di ltar 'jig rten rnams don med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ltar 'jig rten rnams don med par byed pa ste /
translated: but in the same way, the world becomes meaningless.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they turn away from generosity, morality, and so on.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: “Good” means pleasing.

original: rab tu dben pa zhes smos pas ni bag yangs su de ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa zhes smos pas ni bag yangs su de ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word isolated indicates that he teaches with ease.

original: gzhal med khang zhes smos pas ni bdag nyid phyogs de na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang zhes smos pas ni bdag nyid phyogs de na 'dug pa'o //
translated: The word palace indicates that he is present in that place.

original: gzhal med khang la yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas /🔽rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal med khang la yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas / rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since he moves without obstruction in the palace,

original: khyod kyi zhabs dang phyag mdzes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos te /🔽'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus /
analyzed: khyod kyi zhabs dang phyag mdzes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos te / 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus /
translated: the verse Your feet and hands are beautiful indicates that he possesses miraculous powers.

original: bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ston to //🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis smos pas ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ston to // 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis smos pas ni /
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is that he displays his own extraordinary form through the power of his miraculous abilities.🔽The words attachment and aversion

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis gzung ste /
translated: indicate that he has eliminated the two attachments and aversions that are eliminated by the path of cultivation in the desire realm.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bas so //🔽khang bzangs rtsig pa dag la 'ang thogs pa med //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bas so // khang bzangs rtsig pa dag la 'ang thogs pa med //
translated: He is born in the world of Brahma.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: The verse He is not obstructed by walls or mountains indicates that he possesses the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis thogs pa dang bcas pa la yang thogs pa med par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis thogs pa dang bcas pa la yang thogs pa med par 'gro ba'o //
translated: And he goes without impediment even where there is an impediment.

original: sa la 'gro ba bzhin du mkha' la 'chag / ces bya ba ni sa'i 'og dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba ste /
analyzed: sa la 'gro ba bzhin du mkha' la 'chag / ces bya ba ni sa'i 'og dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba ste /
translated: He walks on water as on earth.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ni 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
translated: This shows the miracle of going.

original: glog gi 'od bzhin gzi brjid phun sum tshogs//🔽@315b zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: glog gi 'od bzhin gzi brjid phun sum tshogs// @315b zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: He is endowed with splendor like the lightning.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi sprul pa'o //
translated: This shows the miracle of creation.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems so //
translated: Concentration is the superior mind.

original: tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the morality of restraint.

original: dbang po rnams ni rab tu bsdams //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni rab tu bsdams //
translated: He has well-controlled faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This shows

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
translated: the miracle of the control of the faculties.

original: goms par byas pa ni bsgoms pa'o//🔽'bras bu grub pa 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: goms par byas pa ni bsgoms pa'o// 'bras bu grub pa 'di 'dra'o //
translated: He is one who has practiced.🔽This shows the miracle of instruction.🔽Such is the accomplishment of the fruit.

original: zhes bya ba ni grub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This shows the miracle of the accomplishment of the fruit.🔽How is this?

original: 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: This shows the miracle of reading the thoughts of others.

original: 'di ni rab tu gsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu gsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid do //
translated: This is quite clear.🔽The means of valid knowledge are perception, etc.,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa dang / gang gi mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa dang / gang gi mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: and that of which they are the means of valid knowledge.

original: de nyid rigs pa yin pas mngon sum la sogs pa rigs pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa yin pas mngon sum la sogs pa rigs pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: Since it is reasoning itself, perception, etc., are the means of valid knowledge of reasoning.

original: des gzung du 'os pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa rigs pa'i tshad mas gzung du rung ba ste /
analyzed: des gzung du 'os pa'i phyir mngon sum la sogs pa rigs pa'i tshad mas gzung du rung ba ste /
translated: Since it is suitable to be apprehended by that, perception, etc., are suitable to be apprehended by the means of valid knowledge of reasoning.

original: 'jig rten pha rol lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol lo //
translated: That is the world beyond.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The world beyond is also twofold:

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'di las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol lo //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'di las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol lo //
translated: the world beyond that is other than this human world,

original: de rab tu grub pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i tshad ma dag gis so //
analyzed: de rab tu grub pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i tshad ma dag gis so //
translated: and that is established by the means of valid knowledge of reasoning, such as perception.

original: skye ba 'di las gzhan pa'i skye ba de yang 'jig rten pha rol zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba 'di las gzhan pa'i skye ba de yang 'jig rten pha rol zhes brjod do //
translated: That birth which is other than this birth is also called the world beyond.

original: de yod par ni lung gi tshig gis bstan pa dang / brtag pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de yod par ni lung gi tshig gis bstan pa dang / brtag pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: That exists by the statement of scripture and by the process of investigation.

original: brtag pa'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: brtag pa'i rim pa ni /
translated: The process of investigation is as follows:

original: rigs pas yid ches par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs pas yid ches par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should be convinced by reasoning.

original: de las mi'i 'jig rten las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten yod par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las mi'i 'jig rten las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten yod par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to show that there is a world other than the human world,

original: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa'i nam mkha' dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa'i nam mkha' dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: he mentions the verse beginning with “the sky adorned with the sun, moon, and stars.🔽”

original: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa'i nam mkha' dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten 'di las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten nyid mngon sum gyi rigs pa'i tshad mas gzung du rung ba nyid du bstan to //🔽dud 'gro brtag pa ni /
analyzed: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa'i nam mkha' dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten 'di las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten nyid mngon sum gyi rigs pa'i tshad mas gzung du rung ba nyid du bstan to // dud 'gro brtag pa ni /
translated: By this, “the sky adorned with the sun, moon, and stars,” he shows that there is a world other than this human world, and that it is suitable to be apprehended by the valid knowledge of direct perception.🔽The Chapter on Animals

original: dud 'gro brtag pa ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro brtag pa ste /
translated: The Chapter on Animals

original: glang po che dang / rta dang bong bu rnga mo dang // bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang bong bu rnga mo dang // bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of elephants, horses, donkeys, camels, birds, and so on.

original: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Many kinds means

original: rigs gcig la rnam pa mang po mtha' yas so //
analyzed: rigs gcig la rnam pa mang po mtha' yas so //
translated: in one class there are limitless many kinds.

original: 'di ltar 'bu srin la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bu srin la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang /
translated: Thus, other insects and so on

original: de bzhin nyid du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du sbyar te /
translated: should be applied in the same way.

original: 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten las gzhan du dud 'gro mngon sum gyis yod pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi'i 'jig rten las gzhan du dud 'gro mngon sum gyis yod pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that animals exist in other worlds besides the human world.

original: mngon sum du gsal bar snang ba ni mngon sum bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du gsal bar snang ba ni mngon sum bzhin du'o //
translated: They are directly perceived, just as they are clearly seen.

original: 'di la zhes @316a * //
analyzed: 'di la zhes @316a * //
translated: Here, “this”

original: bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol lo //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol lo //
translated: refers to the other world.

original: stsogs pa smos pas gzung ba'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas gzung ba'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: The scriptures and inferences referred to by the phrase “and so on” are not accepted here.

original: 'dir da ltar byung ba skye ba la /
analyzed: 'dir da ltar byung ba skye ba la /
translated: Here, the existence of present birth

original: 'das pa'i skye ba yod pa nyid du rigs pas bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i skye ba yod pa nyid du rigs pas bstan pa nyid do //
translated: is shown by reasoning to be the same as the existence of past birth.

original: mi'i skye ba yod par sgrub pa yin no //🔽lung gi tshig ni phyogs gnyi ga la yang grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i skye ba yod par sgrub pa yin no // lung gi tshig ni phyogs gnyi ga la yang grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The existence of human birth is established.🔽The scriptural passages are accepted by both parties.

original: lung gi tshig gnyi gar yang ngo //
analyzed: lung gi tshig gnyi gar yang ngo //
translated: Both scriptural passages are accepted by both parties.

original: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad drug smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad drug smos te /
translated: The six verses beginning with “Having cultivated the absorptions”

original: skye ba 'di las 'das pa'i skye ba rjes su dpag pas yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba 'di las 'das pa'i skye ba rjes su dpag pas yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: are stated to prove the existence of past birth by inference from this birth.

original: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di smos te /
translated: This verse is called “Cultivating Meditation. ”

original: da ltar byung ba'i skye ba las 'das pa'i skye ba dmigs te dran par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i skye ba las 'das pa'i skye ba dmigs te dran par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees and remembers past births, which are in the present.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes bya ba la /🔽'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes bya ba la / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: “The world beyond exists” means🔽that the world beyond exists.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ni 'das pa'i skye ba yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ni 'das pa'i skye ba yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The world beyond exists means that past births exist.

original: bsam gtan la goms pa dang / dran pa gsal ba nyid kyis ni skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la goms pa dang / dran pa gsal ba nyid kyis ni skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees the present birth through cultivating meditation and through the clarity of memory.

original: nga bdag las kyang mngon par mi 'gyur ram //
analyzed: nga bdag las kyang mngon par mi 'gyur ram //
translated: “Would I not appear from myself?”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: bdag nyid dpe nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid dpe nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that he should take himself as an example.

original: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan goms byas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: “Cultivating meditation” means that, based on meditation,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ston to //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ston to //
translated: he demonstrates the superknowledge of the knowledge remembering past lives.

original: dran pa gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan thob na /
analyzed: dran pa gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan thob na /
translated: “The clarity of memory” means that, having attained meditation,🔽he remembers past lives.

original: tshe rabs dran pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
analyzed: tshe rabs dran pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
translated: It shows the cause of the recollection of former lives.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs dran par snang ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs dran par snang ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From that means from the appearance of the recollection of former lives and from the recollection of former lives.

original: lhag ma thams cad kyang 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir tshigs bcad lnga smos so //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad kyang 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir tshigs bcad lnga smos so //
translated: The remaining five verses are stated to demonstrate the existence of another world.

original: blo gzhan song ba las blo gzhan skye ba yin te /
analyzed: blo gzhan song ba las blo gzhan skye ba yin te /
translated: The mind arises from the mind that has gone,🔽and the mind that has gone is not the mind that arises.🔽Therefore, in order to prove that there is another world,

original: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: the verse,

original: snga ma'i blo las phyi ma'i blo 'grub na //
analyzed: snga ma'i blo las phyi ma'i blo 'grub na //
translated: If the later mind is established from the former mind,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: is stated.

original: mngal na 'dug pa'i sngon rol blo //
analyzed: mngal na 'dug pa'i sngon rol blo //
translated: The mind prior to entering the womb

original: zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du byas pa las thams cad 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du byas pa las thams cad 'gyur te /
translated: means that everything occurs from the prior mind.

original: blo sngon du 'gro bar snang bas /
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro bar snang bas /
translated: Since the mind is seen to precede,

original: dper na da ltar byung ba'i mngal gyi snga rol du blo 'byung ba ni snga ma'i blo yin te /
analyzed: dper na da ltar byung ba'i mngal gyi snga rol du blo 'byung ba ni snga ma'i blo yin te /
translated: for example, the mind prior to the present womb is the former mind.

original: de ni 'jig rten pha rol lo //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pha rol lo //
translated: That is the other world.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the world beyond does exist.

original: dang po'i blo ni yul yod par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po'i blo ni yul yod par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The first cognition is of an existent object.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin no @316b zhes sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin no @316b zhes sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that the world beyond exists,

original: shes bya rtogs par byed pa blo yin zer //
analyzed: shes bya rtogs par byed pa blo yin zer //
translated: it is said that cognition is that which realizes the object of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: This is the verse.

original: dang po'i skye ba'i blo ni yul yod pa nyid do //🔽yul med par ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs par mi snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang po'i skye ba'i blo ni yul yod pa nyid do // yul med par ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs par mi snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The first cognition is of an existent object.

original: da ltar byung ba'i blo lta bur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i blo lta bur ro //
translated: It is not seen to realize itself without an object, like the cognition of the present.

original: dang po'i blo'i yul du gyur pa de ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
analyzed: dang po'i blo'i yul du gyur pa de ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
translated: The object of the first cognition is the world beyond.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
translated: Therefore, the world beyond exists.

original: dang po'i blo ni 'das pa'i yul gyi yin te /
analyzed: dang po'i blo ni 'das pa'i yul gyi yin te /
translated: The first cognition is of a past object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dag med cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang la brten nas skye ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dag med cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang la brten nas skye ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five sense faculties such as the eye do not exist, and the mental consciousness does not arise in dependence on any sense faculty such as the eye.

original: kha cig 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Some say this:

original: ji ltar shing la sogs pa sems can ma yin pa ston pa rnams rang gi sa bon gyi bye brag gis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yang yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sogs pa sems can ma yin pa ston pa rnams rang gi sa bon gyi bye brag gis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yang yod de /
translated: Just as non-sentient things such as trees, etc., which are taught, exist with various natures due to the particularities of their seeds,

original: de dag la 'jig rten pha rol med pa de bzhin du sems can du bstan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang pha ma'i khu khrag gi sa bon gyi bye brag gis de de dang mthun par sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod de /
analyzed: de dag la 'jig rten pha rol med pa de bzhin du sems can du bstan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang pha ma'i khu khrag gi sa bon gyi bye brag gis de de dang mthun par sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod de /
translated: so too do things taught as sentient exist with various natures in accordance with their seeds of father and mother’s blood and semen,🔽but they do not exist in a subsequent world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol na ni med do zhes de ltar smras pa de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol na ni med do zhes de ltar smras pa de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In consideration of that,

original: skye dgu'i tshul khrims la sogs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: skye dgu'i tshul khrims la sogs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse “The morality of living beings, etc.” is stated.

original: pha ma gnyis kyi yin pas pha ma gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: pha ma gnyis kyi yin pas pha ma gnyis kyi'o //
translated: Since it is of both father and mother, it is of both father and mother.

original: de'i rang bzhin dag dang mi mthun pa ni 'das pa'am tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dag dang mi mthun pa ni 'das pa'am tha dad pa'o //
translated: That which is not in accordance with its nature is past or different.

original: tshul khrims la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs bzang ba dang / gzugs ngan pa dang / phyug bo dang / dbul po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba'o //🔽glo bur du gyur pa med de zhes bya bas ni /🔽rgyu med pa'i smra ba'i rgyu med pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor bas so//
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs bzang ba dang / gzugs ngan pa dang / phyug bo dang / dbul po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba'o // glo bur du gyur pa med de zhes bya bas ni / rgyu med pa'i smra ba'i rgyu med pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor bas so//
translated: The phrase morality, etc. refers to the distinctions of good and bad physical form, wealth, poverty, etc.🔽The phrase there is no adventitious distinction refers to the fact that there is no distinction of cause.

original: yang na rgyu med pa'i gang yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rgyu med pa'i gang yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase there is no distinction of cause refers to the fact that there is no distinction of cause.

original: gal te de lta yin na ni pha ma la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi bye brag las sems can rnams kyi khyad par de ltar 'jug pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ni pha ma la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi bye brag las sems can rnams kyi khyad par de ltar 'jug pa med dam zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then why do sentient beings enter into such distinctions as father, mother, etc., on the basis of the distinctions of the seeds, i.e., the parents?

original: med de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: med de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: There is no such distinction. Why is this?

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bye brag pha ma'i rang bzhin dag dang mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bye brag pha ma'i rang bzhin dag dang mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the distinctions of morality, etc., appear contrary to the nature of the parents.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la sogs pa kha cig 'di skad du glo bur du sgrub pa yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la sogs pa kha cig 'di skad du glo bur du sgrub pa yin no zhes smras te /
translated: Some, such as the Lokāyatas, say that this is established adventitiously.

original: glo bur 'byung ba ni zhes mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: glo bur 'byung ba ni zhes mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: because the text does not read “the adventitious elements.”

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni yod de /
translated: The other world exists,

original: thams cad kyang rgyu dang bcas pas snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa la glo bur gyi dbye @317a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rgyu dang bcas pas snang ba'i phyir ro // 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa la glo bur gyi dbye @317a * //
translated: because everything is seen to have a cause.

original: ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because a sudden division is not seen in a pot, etc.,

original: ji ltar nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: it is like space.

original: 'on kyang lhag ma ni skye ba gzhan la goms pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhag ma ni skye ba gzhan la goms pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: However, the rest is a special cultivation in another birth.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
translated: Therefore, the other world exists.

original: skyes ma thag tu sems can gyi skye ba'i rgyu sred pas byas pa'i bya ba la 'jug par snang ba las brtsams te /🔽blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //🔽blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu sems can gyi skye ba'i rgyu sred pas byas pa'i bya ba la 'jug par snang ba las brtsams te / blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so // blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Immediately after birth, a sentient being is seen to engage in activity done by craving, the cause of birth.🔽The verse “the power of the mind” is stated beginning from that.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The power of the mind refers to the mental consciousness.

original: blun pa'i dbang po rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: blun pa'i dbang po rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The power of the dull faculties refers to the five sense consciousnesses.

original: ma bstan par zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bstan pa med par ro //
analyzed: ma bstan par zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bstan pa med par ro //
translated: Without being taught means without being taught by another.

original: btsas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: btsas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu'o //
translated: Immediately after birth means as soon as born.

original: blo'i mthu stobs gsal ba med ces bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo'i mthu stobs gsal ba med ces bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that there is no clear power of mind,

original: kha zas za bar rtsol bar zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
analyzed: kha zas za bar rtsol bar zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
translated: the verse, “He strives to eat food,” is stated.

original: dang po'i chos bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i chos bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The first line of the verse is the thesis.

original: srid pa gzhan la kha zas za bar rtsol bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa gzhan la kha zas za bar rtsol bar byas pa yin te /
translated: He strives to eat food in another life.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa med par skyes ma thag tu nu zho 'thung bar rtsol bar snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa med par skyes ma thag tu nu zho 'thung bar rtsol bar snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because immediately after birth, he is seen to strive to drink milk without being taught by another.

original: goms pa'i chos rnams la 'bad pa med par 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: goms pa'i chos rnams la 'bad pa med par 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the effortless engagement in habitual phenomena.

original: gal te rtsol ba med par bya ba la 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: gal te rtsol ba med par bya ba la 'jug pa med de /
translated: If there is no engagement in effortless activity,🔽then there is no engagement in habitual phenomena.

original: srid pa gzhan la goms pa'i bya ba med par mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na ni padma rnams kyang kha bye ba dang ; zums pa dag srid pa gzhan la goms pa'i rgyu dang bcas par khyed kyi gzhung la grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa gzhan la goms pa'i bya ba med par mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na ni padma rnams kyang kha bye ba dang ; zums pa dag srid pa gzhan la goms pa'i rgyu dang bcas par khyed kyi gzhung la grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the opening and closing of lotuses is not possible without the cause of habituation to other existences, then in your system it is established that the opening and closing of lotuses have a cause consisting of habituation to other existences.

analyzed: 'dir khyod rang dbang med pa'o //

analyzed: bu yug rlung gis zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /

analyzed: rus pa dum bu brgyar zhigs pa des phongs shing sgra 'byin pa ga la yod pa de ni rus pa brgyar zhigs phongs pa'i sgra 'byin pa'o //

analyzed: gshin rje'i gshed pos bsad par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad @319a * //

analyzed: 'di ni dmyal ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsdu na rnam pa bdun du 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir gshin rje'i gshed pa pos gsad par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar bsad pa zhe na /

original: de bsad pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsad pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gsad dang bcad dang gshags dang brdeg pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //

original: bsad pa ni rdo la sogs pas so //🔽bcad pa ni ral gri la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bsad pa ni rdo la sogs pas so // bcad pa ni ral gri la sogs pas so //
translated: Killing is by means of stones and so forth.🔽Cutting is by means of swords and so forth.

original: gshags pa ni sog le la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gshags pa ni sog le la sogs pas so //
translated: Hacking is by means of saws and so forth.

original: bsregs pa ni me 'am /
analyzed: bsregs pa ni me 'am /
translated: Burning is by means of fire or

original: rdza ma chen po'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: rdza ma chen po'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: They are placed in a great iron pot

analyzed: btso ba la sogs pas so ; / gzhog pa ni ste'u la sogs pas so //
translated: and boiled, etc.🔽They are ground up with pestles.🔽They are beaten with elephants, etc.

analyzed: brdung ba ni ban glang la sogs pa dang / bsdus 'joms kyi ri bo la sogs pas so //

original: gzhig pa ni mdung thung la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhig pa ni mdung thung la sogs pas so //

original: gnod pa mang pos sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gnod pa mang pos sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: They suffer from many injuries.

original: de ltar bshad pa dag las ma grol ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa dag las ma grol ba yin na /
translated: If they are not freed from these explanations,

original: ji ltar ngal bu lon gzhal ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ngal bu lon gzhal ba'o //
translated: how can they be freed from the debt of their children?

original: de dag bdag gis zhes bya bas ni bsad pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de dag bdag gis zhes bya bas ni bsad pa la sogs pas so //
translated: They are mine, etc.

original: dge ba dag gi gnas ni dge ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba dag gi gnas ni dge ba'i gnas so //

original: yang na dge ba'i gnas gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i gnas gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i gnas so //
translated: Or, that which is the abode of virtue is the abode of virtue.

original: gnod pa mang pos yid mi dga' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i gtam thos pas so //
analyzed: gnod pa mang pos yid mi dga' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i gtam thos pas so //
translated: They become unhappy from many injuries means that they hear about the hells.

original: lta ba drang por gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de smad par bya ba'i log pa'i lta ba yongs su btang bas so //
analyzed: lta ba drang por gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de smad par bya ba'i log pa'i lta ba yongs su btang bas so //
translated: Having become upright in their views means that they give up the wrong views that should be condemned.

original: chos sgrub pa'i snod ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i snod do //
analyzed: chos sgrub pa'i snod ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i snod do //
translated: The phrase “a vessel for practicing the Dharma” means a vessel for practicing the path that leads to nirvana.

original: yang na chos ni bsod nams kyi chogs te /
analyzed: yang na chos ni bsod nams kyi chogs te /

original: de sgrub pa'i snod do //🔽sngon gyi rgyal po yon tan dga' ba rnams //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i snod do // sngon gyi rgyal po yon tan dga' ba rnams //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni snying rje'i zhing sgrub pa nyid bstan to //

analyzed: grags ldan zhes bya bas ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon yin no // mtho ris 'gro zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: The line beginning with the words “renowned” teaches the benefits in this life.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi yon tan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi yon tan no //
translated: The line beginning with the words “who went to heaven” teaches the benefits in future lives.

original: de bas na chos min thub dka' thub byed cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na chos min thub dka' thub byed cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the line beginning with the words “the practice of austerities that is not Dharma” teaches the accumulation of merit that is morality.

analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las chos kyis rgyal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words “he triumphs over the Dharma through the Dharma, which is the opposite of the non-Dharma”,

original: ser sna ni chags @319b pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni chags @319b pa ste /

analyzed: de med pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs te gnyen po yin no //

original: de ring du spangs pa ni gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ring du spangs pa ni gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the antidote,

analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs nyid du bstan to //

original: rin chen mchog 'bar zhes bya ba des 'gro bas so //
analyzed: rin chen mchog 'bar zhes bya ba des 'gro bas so //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'dris pa ni goms pa'o //

original: gnas pa ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni brten pa'o //

original: blo ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: byis pa dag chags par byed pas ni byis pa dga' bar byed pa ste /

original: byis pa dga' bar byed pa nges so //
analyzed: byis pa dga' bar byed pa nges so //

analyzed: chos nyid nges pa zhes bya ba ni chos la nges pa'o // yang dag pa'i lta ba yang yin la /

original: dge pa yang yin bas yang dag lta ba dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge pa yang yin bas yang dag lta ba dge ba'o //
translated: so it is right view and virtue.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dge ba des /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dge ba des /
translated: By that wholesome right view,

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni phyin chad do //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni phyin chad do //
translated: “From now on” means from this time forth.

original: 'gro bar spro ba ni 'gro bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar spro ba ni 'gro bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Inclined to go” means desirous of going.

original: yon tan dag la rtsub pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan dag la rtsub pa ni /
translated: “Roughness with regard to virtues”

original: yon tan dag la mi dga' ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan dag la mi dga' ba ste /
translated: means lack of delight in virtues.

original: mi dga' ba ni skyo ba'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni skyo ba'o //

original: lam du gyur pa'i go 'phang des /
analyzed: lam du gyur pa'i go 'phang des /

original: lam du byas pa yin pas lam du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lam du byas pa yin pas lam du gyur pa'o //
translated: he makes it into the path, thus it is a stage which is the path.

analyzed: go 'phang ni lam du gyur pa'i rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: A stage is a firm station which is the path.

original: yon tan sgrub pa dbyig tu byos //
analyzed: yon tan sgrub pa dbyig tu byos //
translated: Make virtue your wealth.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: This shows

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs zhes bya ba 'dis ni /

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //

original: tshul khrims brtan zhing dbang po rab tu sdoms //
analyzed: tshul khrims brtan zhing dbang po rab tu sdoms //

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: shows the perfection of morality.

original: rab gsal zhes bya ba ni nus pa che bas so //
analyzed: rab gsal zhes bya ba ni nus pa che bas so //
translated: “Very clear” means having great power.

original: yid du 'ong bas ni yid kyi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong bas ni yid kyi nus pa nyid do //

analyzed: grags pa ni snyan pa'i phan pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'o //

analyzed: de yang shing rta yod pa de ni shing rta dag go //

translated: The chariot of the gift of honor is the chariot of the gift of honor, which is the gift of honor itself.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i shing rta dag go //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i shing rta dag go //
translated: The chariot of proper mental attention is the chariot of proper mental attention.

analyzed: yon tan 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan skye ba yin pas yon tan 'byung ba ste /

analyzed: de ni shing rta nyid de rang gi lus so //
translated: That is the chariot itself, which is one's own body.

original: mi rtsub pa'i mig dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtsub mig ldan te /
analyzed: mi rtsub pa'i mig dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtsub mig ldan te /
translated: The one with eyes free from harshness is the one with eyes free from harshness.

original: mi rtsub pa'i byams pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa'i byams pa'o //

original: sbyin pa dang dul ba ni sbyin dul lo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang dul ba ni sbyin dul lo //

analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'khor lo gang la yod pa de ni sbyin dul 'khor lo can no //
translated: The one who has the wheel of those two is the one with the wheel of gift and discipline.

analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsod nams nyid 'dod pa'i bsod nams pa zhes bya @320a * //
translated: Generosity, ethics and merit are called the merit of desire.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is a bodhisattva who is a practitioner of merit, because he is devoted to generosity, morality, and merit.

original: dbang po dul ba ni dbang po bsdams pa'o //🔽dran pa nyid srab skyogs yin pas dran pa'i srab skyogs can no //
analyzed: dbang po dul ba ni dbang po bsdams pa'o // dran pa nyid srab skyogs yin pas dran pa'i srab skyogs can no //
translated: He is self-controlled, because he has controlled his senses.🔽He is a charioteer of mindfulness, because mindfulness is the reins.

analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa nyid lcag yin pas shes rab kyi skul ma'o // thos pa rgya che ba nyid kyi mtshon gang la yod pa de ni /

original: thos pa rgya chen mtshon no //
analyzed: thos pa rgya chen mtshon no //
translated: He is armed with the weapon of vast learning.

original: ngo tsha nyid yo byad yin pas ngo tsha yo byad do //
analyzed: ngo tsha nyid yo byad yin pas ngo tsha yo byad do //
translated: He is a charioteer of shame, because shame is the equipment.

original: bcings pa mdzes pa'i grogs gang yin pa de ni grogs mdzes pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: bcings pa mdzes pa'i grogs gang yin pa de ni grogs mdzes pas bcings pa'o //
translated: He is bound with the bonds of a beautiful friend, because he is bound with the bonds of a beautiful friend.

original: bzod pa nyid kyi gnya' shing gang la yod pa de ni bzod pa'i gnya' shing ngo //
analyzed: bzod pa nyid kyi gnya' shing gang la yod pa de ni bzod pa'i gnya' shing ngo //
translated: He is a yoke of patience, because patience is the yoke.

original: 'gro ba brtan pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba brtan pa'o ;
analyzed: 'gro ba brtan pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba brtan pa'o ;
translated: He is a stable goer, because he is a stable goer.

original: / tshig nyid ngan pa yin pas tshig ngan no //
analyzed: / tshig nyid ngan pa yin pas tshig ngan no //
translated: He is a bad speaker, because speech is bad.

original: de bsdams pa ni tshig ngan bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de bsdams pa ni tshig ngan bsdams pa'o //
translated: Restraining that is restraining bad speech.

original: tshig ngan pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi skyon rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi skyon rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Bad speech is the four faults of speech, such as lying.

original: yid 'ong tshig tsam smra bas zab pa'i sgra //
analyzed: yid 'ong tshig tsam smra bas zab pa'i sgra //
translated: Speaking only pleasant words is the sound of the profound.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dge ba'i las kyi lam gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dge ba'i las kyi lam gzung ngo //
translated: This refers to taking up the path of virtuous action, the opposite of bad speech.

original: bsdams pa ma zhig pas na mtshams ma bye zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba bstan to //
analyzed: bsdams pa ma zhig pas na mtshams ma bye zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba bstan to //
translated: Not breaking the boundary is not opening the boundary. This shows right livelihood.

original: spyod pa ngan pa'i gya gyu spangs pas drang //
analyzed: spyod pa ngan pa'i gya gyu spangs pas drang //
translated: Abandoning the crookedness of bad conduct is straight.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bstan to //
translated: This shows right action.

original: rgyal mtshan mtho zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba mtho pa'o ;
analyzed: rgyal mtshan mtho zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba mtho pa'o ;
translated: The high banner is the high peace of the afflictions.

original: / slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: / slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This completes the Jātakamālā of Āryaśūra.

original: // / gzhan dag la phan pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa'o //
analyzed: // / gzhan dag la phan pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa'o //
translated: Benefiting others is benefiting others.

original: de nyid shas che ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni gzhan la phan par byed pa'i sdug bsngal lo//
analyzed: de nyid shas che ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni gzhan la phan par byed pa'i sdug bsngal lo//
translated: The suffering that is predominantly that is the suffering that benefits others.

original: yul ljongs thag ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul ljongs thag ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the region became distant means

original: grong gi skye bo dang thag bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: grong gi skye bo dang thag bsrings pa'o //
translated: that he was far from the people of the city.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yin te /
translated: The word peace means morality,

original: lus kyi las kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: which is the characteristic of physical action.

analyzed: spyugs pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi skye bo dang bral bar byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase was banished means that he was separated from the people of the country.

analyzed: khros pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa yod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word angry means with a fault, that is, the meaning of with a crime.

analyzed: de dag gis mi rigs pa byas pa ni nyes pa yod pas rgyal pos spyugs pa'o //
translated: They did something improper, and so the king banished them with a fault.

original: gcom chung ba ni gzi brjid chung ba'o //
analyzed: gcom chung ba ni gzi brjid chung ba'o //
translated: The word weak means without power.

original: nyam thag cing phongs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni nyam thag phongs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: nyam thag cing phongs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni nyam thag phongs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The phrase only the sound of lamentation and despair means only the sound of lamentation and despair.

original: nags tshal de logs su 'ong ba ni nags tshal de la mngon du @320b phyogs te 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: nags tshal de logs su 'ong ba ni nags tshal de la mngon du @320b phyogs te 'ong ba'o //
translated: The phrase came to that forest means came in the direction of that forest.

original: gangs ri'i rtse mo 'gro shes pa 'dra bzhes bya bas ni mdog dang mtshan nyid bstan to //🔽ston ka'i sprin nam /
analyzed: gangs ri'i rtse mo 'gro shes pa 'dra bzhes bya bas ni mdog dang mtshan nyid bstan to // ston ka'i sprin nam /
translated: The phrase “like the peak of a snow mountain” indicates the color and the characteristics.🔽Like a cloud in autumn,

original: na bun gyi tshogs rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na bun gyi tshogs rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or like a mass of mist stirred by the wind.

original: 'gros dang / mdog dang / tshang mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gros dang / mdog dang / tshang mthun pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates the gait and the color and the size.

original: mdog cung zad dmar zhing snum pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: rtag tu na ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis so // nyon mongs pa mang po'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are without a friend because they are without a friend who would not abandon them to suffering.🔽They are without a leader because they are without a leader who would lead them to the city of nirvana.🔽They are without a savior because they are without a savior who would rescue them from all suffering.🔽They are without a protector because they are without a protector who would protect them from all suffering.

original: gnod pa sna tshogs skye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nas de dag la kha cig ni zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni /

analyzed: sems mi brtan pa'i @322a * // dbang du byas pa'o //

analyzed: bdag cag mgon med rnams kyi mgon // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni /

original: sems stobs bar ma'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems stobs bar ma'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: They are without a leader because they

analyzed: bde 'gro thob phyir zhes bya ba ni mi nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi dbang rgyal srid gdugs gcig dpa' phyir zhes bya ba ni /

translated: “Not for the sake of experiencing the highest bliss of the heavens” means not even for the sake of attaining the higher realms of the desire realm.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa ni g-yang sar mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i phyir yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: not even for the sake of attaining the higher realms of the form and formless realms, which are like a precipice.

original: thar pa'i bde phyir min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thar pa'i bde phyir min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not for the sake of the bliss of liberation” means

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phyir yang ma yin pa'o //

original: g-yang sar ltung ste zhig na ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: g-yang sar ltung ste zhig na ni 'chi ba'o //

analyzed: de gnyis kyis byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni g-yang sar ltung ste zhig nas 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: sa phyogs de zhes bya ba ni de dag la sngar phyogs gang bstan pa'i phyogs der zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gangs ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni gangs ri nas lhung ba de'i gangs ri de'i rtse mo nyid do // gnam grum pa'i sgra gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: The peak of the snow mountain is the peak of the snow mountain from which they fell.🔽The sound of the splitting of the sky is the sound of the splitting of the sky.

original: gnam grum sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: gnam grum sgra bzhin no //

analyzed: ma btags zhes bya ba ni dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: me tog ku mud spungs ltar mdzes //
analyzed: me tog ku mud spungs ltar mdzes //
translated: Beautiful like a heap of kumuda flowers,

original: zla ba'i 'od zer spungs pa bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer spungs pa bzhin //

original: zhes bya ba de de gnyis kyis mdog bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de de gnyis kyis mdog bstan to //

original: 'di ni de yi gzugs brnyan zhig //

analyzed: ma thos par zhes bya ba ni ma 'dris par zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: bdag cag rnams kyis bya ba'i rigs so //

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dris pa dag la ni 'dris pa la ltos pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dris pa dag la ni 'dris pa la ltos pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /

original: de bas na 'dris pa'ang med do //

translated: What is the benefit of liberating us?🔽He said, Therefore, although the body is very dear, I gave it up because they are very dear guests.

original: lus pas kyang rab tu gces pa ni gang gi phyir mgron yin pa'i phyir te lus btang ba'o //
analyzed: lus pas kyang rab tu gces pa ni gang gi phyir mgron yin pa'i phyir te lus btang ba'o //
translated: Because they are more dear than the body, I gave up my body because they are guests.

original: bsam pa ni bdag cag bsgral ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni bdag cag bsgral ba'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The thought is the thought of liberating us.

original: rab tu gces pa'i mgron yin pa'i phyir lus btang ba yin no //🔽de bas na gzhan du na @323b zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu gces pa'i mgron yin pa'i phyir lus btang ba yin no // de bas na gzhan du na @323b zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because they are very dear guests, I gave up my body.

analyzed: de'i bsam pa ma byas par gyur na ni byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, otherwise means that if I did not act on that thought, my actions would be meaningless.

analyzed: rab tu gces pa'i mgron la rab tu phangs pa'i lus btang ba byas pa'i 'bad pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar re zhig byang chub sems dpa' las rjes su ma blangs na rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /

analyzed: da ni bdag cag nyid kyis ma blangs pa mi mthun pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di yis byas te ci bdog pa // zhes bya ba'i tshigs cad smos te / gzhan du byas na don med 'gyur //
translated: What is there that he has not given?🔽What is there that he has not given?🔽In order to establish that it is meaningless if he gives to others, he says:

original: zhes bya ba 'di don med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di don med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: It would be meaningless if he gave to others.

original: byams pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽ci bdog pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o // ci bdog pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Love is the perfection of attitude.🔽What is there that he has not given? is the perfection of application.

original: bdog pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: All that he has is the perfection of the gift to be given.

original: bdag cag rnams kyis ma blangs na don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis ma blangs na don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: It would be meaningless if he gave to others, because it would be meaningless if we did not accept.

original: bdag cag rnams kyis ma blangs na'o //
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis ma blangs na'o //
translated: If we do not accept it.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de ni mgron no //
analyzed: de ni mgron no //
translated: It is the guest.

original: de las ci zhig bkur sti bya //
analyzed: de las ci zhig bkur sti bya //
translated: What service is rendered to him?

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i me la sbyang ba des bu lon med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i me la sbyang ba des bu lon med pa ste /
translated: The debt-free state is taught by the fire-purification mentioned above.

original: des mes ma bsregs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: des mes ma bsregs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: It shows that he is not burned by the fire.

original: gal te ma blangs pa dang / me la sbyangs pas ma bsregs na //
analyzed: gal te ma blangs pa dang / me la sbyangs pas ma bsregs na //
translated: If he is not accepted and is not burned by the fire-purification,

original: de ltar na bkur sti ci zhig byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bkur sti ci zhig byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: what service is rendered to him?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says:

original: de bas de la bla ma bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so//
analyzed: de bas de la bla ma bzhin // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so//
translated: Therefore, he should be served as a guru.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ma blangs shing don med pa des mgron gyi bsnyen bkur med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ma blangs shing don med pa des mgron gyi bsnyen bkur med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore means that because he is not accepted and is not served as a guest,

original: de las gzhan pa de'i tshig nyan par byas na bkur sti nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa de'i tshig nyan par byas na bkur sti nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is taught that the service rendered to him is listening to his words.

original: bkur sti chen po bya ba tsam du ma zad de /
analyzed: bkur sti chen po bya ba tsam du ma zad de /
translated: Not only is he to be served with great service,🔽but also:

original: de bdag la phan par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang bkur sti chen po bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: de bdag la phan par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang bkur sti chen po bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: It is also right to show great respect to him because he will benefit me.

original: de'i tshig mnyan par bya bas so //
analyzed: de'i tshig mnyan par bya bas so //
translated: For his words are to be listened to.

original: gal te khyed cag gis de la byas pa gzo ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gis de la byas pa gzo ba'i phyir /
translated: If you do honor to him in order to repay his kindness,🔽then I will do so too.

original: de la mchod pa byas na yang de bzhin du bya zhing mngon par mchod pa'i cho ga'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mchod pa byas na yang de bzhin du bya zhing mngon par mchod pa'i cho ga'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the method of worship, he says,

original: sdug bsngal 'di las thar nas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di las thar nas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: Having been freed from this suffering...

original: sdug bsngal 'di las thar pa zhes bya ba ni 'brog dgon pa 'di'i sdug bsngal las thar pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di las thar pa zhes bya ba ni 'brog dgon pa 'di'i sdug bsngal las thar pa'o //
translated: Having been freed from this suffering means having been freed from the suffering of this wilderness.

original: tshogs pa ni 'dus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni 'dus par gyur pa'o //
translated: Assembly means a gathering.

original: de dag gi tshig ni de dag gi tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig ni de dag gi tshig go //
translated: Their words means their words.

original: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This completes the story of the elephant, the first chapter in the great commentary on the Buddha's Jataka Tales composed by Acharya Chanakya.

original: // / sdom la /
analyzed: // / sdom la /
translated: The summary:

original: byang chub ngang pa byang chub @324a * //
analyzed: byang chub ngang pa byang chub @324a * //
translated: Bodhisattva, swan, great awakening,

original: che ; / spre'u dang ri dvags sha ra bha //
analyzed: che ; / spre'u dang ri dvags sha ra bha //
translated: monkey, deer, Sharabha,

original: ru ru spre'u rgyal bzod pa smra //
analyzed: ru ru spre'u rgyal bzod pa smra //
translated: Ruru, the king of monkeys, Kṣāntivādi,

original: tshangs dang glang chen de dag bcu //
analyzed: tshangs dang glang chen de dag bcu //
translated: Brahmā, and the elephant—these are the ten.

original: sdom 'di ni 'jig rten du grags pa yin te /
analyzed: sdom 'di ni 'jig rten du grags pa yin te /
translated: This summary is well known in the world.

original: skyes pa'i rabs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims bdag gis ni 'di ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims bdag gis ni 'di ltar mthong ngo //
translated: I have seen the order of these ten jātakas in this way.

original: byang chub ngang pa byang chub che //
analyzed: byang chub ngang pa byang chub che //
translated: The swan of enlightenment, the great enlightenment,🔽Ruru, the king of monkeys, Kṣāntivādi, the king of monkeys,

original: sha ra ru ru spre'u dang // bzod pa smra dang spre'u rgyal dang // glang chen tshangs pa de dag bcu //
analyzed: sha ra ru ru spre'u dang // bzod pa smra dang spre'u rgyal dang // glang chen tshangs pa de dag bcu //
translated: the elephant, and Brahmā—these are the ten.

original: 'dir skyes pa'i rabs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims kyi rgyu yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir skyes pa'i rabs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims kyi rgyu yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Here, the cause of the order of these ten jātakas is also based on the perfection of patience.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la mi med pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la mi med pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience in the absence of harm by others, patience in not minding suffering, and patience in being certain about the Dharma.

original: de la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Regarding that, based on patience in being certain about the Dharma,

original: tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs yin te /
translated: there is the jātaka of Brahmā.

original: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos dag la 'dod cing mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos dag la 'dod cing mi skrag pa'o //
translated: Patience of the ascertainment of Dharma is the desire for and non-fear of the profound and extensive Dharma.

original: bzod pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do we know that this patience exists for the bodhisattva?

original: bdag nyid mngon par 'dod pa'i lta ba de la gzhan yang rab tu 'god pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par 'dod pa'i lta ba de la gzhan yang rab tu 'god pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he establishes others in that view which he himself desires.

original: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa de ni tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa de ni tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: This patience of the ascertainment of Dharma is expressed by the life of Brahma.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar skyes pa'i rabs 'di bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su bshad /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar skyes pa'i rabs 'di bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su bshad /
translated: Otherwise, how could this life story be explained as a life story of the perfection of patience?

original: gal te 'di ltar blo skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar blo skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the following thought occurs:

original: skyes pa'i rabs de nyid du bstan pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs de nyid du bstan pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of patience taught in that life story🔽is explained as the life story of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid du bshad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs 'di ni rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du bshad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs 'di ni rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: That is logical.

original: de yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bzod pa gong nas gong du khyad par du bstan pa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod pa gong nas gong du khyad par du bstan pa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
