translated: because it is in order to teach the stages of the Jataka Tales, which are the special topics of the perfections of patience and so on.

original: bzod pa'i tshig de ni zhar las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i tshig de ni zhar las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “patience” is mentioned only incidentally.

original: gtsor ni rang bzhin gyis lta ba ngan pa la zhen par gyur pa la lhag par snying brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: gtsor ni rang bzhin gyis lta ba ngan pa la zhen par gyur pa la lhag par snying brtse ba yin te /
translated: The main point is the special compassion for those who are attached to bad views by nature.

original: de bas na tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs ni chos la nges par sems pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid ngo ;
analyzed: de bas na tshangs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs ni chos la nges par sems pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid ngo ;
translated: Therefore, the Brahma Jataka is based on the discernment of dharmas.

original: / spre'u'i rgyal po dang / glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: / spre'u'i rgyal po dang / glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: In the Jataka Tales of the Monkey King and the Elephant, the perfection of patience is based on the forbearance of suffering.

original: gnyis po de dag las kyang gnod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas pa ni spre'u rgyal po'i skyes pa'i rabs su bstan te @324b mi bzod pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa
analyzed: gnyis po de dag las kyang gnod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas pa ni spre'u rgyal po'i skyes pa'i rabs su bstan te @324b mi bzod pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa
translated: And from among those two, the perfection of patience which is indifference to the suffering of harm is illustrated in the Jataka of the King of Monkeys, because there is no impatience.

original: ste / gnod par byed pa'i rgyal po la bzod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: ste / gnod par byed pa'i rgyal po la bzod par bya ba ni /
translated: Patience with regard to the harm of a king is

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyal po nyid kyang phan pa byed par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyal po nyid kyang phan pa byed par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection, and because the king himself is engaged in doing good.

original: glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni g-yang sa nas ltung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: glang po che'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni g-yang sa nas ltung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: In the Jataka of the Elephant, the perfection of patience which is indifference to the suffering of a fall and the suffering of death is illustrated,

original: ma 'dris pa'i skye bo la rjes su brtse ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa'i skye bo la rjes su brtse ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the compassion for the stranger.

original: de las gzhan pa skyes pa'i rabs bdun gyis ni gnod pa byas pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa skyes pa'i rabs bdun gyis ni gnod pa byas pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The other seven birth stories illustrate the perfection of patience which is indifference to the harm of others.

original: gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽bdag dang 'brel pa dang / bdag la gnod pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te / bdag dang 'brel pa dang / bdag la gnod pa byas pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of harm-doers:🔽those related to oneself and those who do harm to oneself.

original: bdag dang 'brel pa la gnod pa byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa la gnod pa byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to those related to oneself,

original: gtsug phud byang chub kyi skyes pa'i rabs su rgyal po des rang gi chung ma 'phrog par byed pa'i gnod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug phud byang chub kyi skyes pa'i rabs su rgyal po des rang gi chung ma 'phrog par byed pa'i gnod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the Jataka of Sikhandhi, the king was harmed by the abduction of his wife.

original: bdag la gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of harm-doers to oneself:

original: rnam par 'tsho ba'i gnod pa dang / gsod pa'i gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tsho ba'i gnod pa dang / gsod pa'i gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: those who harm by injuring and those who harm by killing.

original: de las rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de las rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to those who harm by injuring,

original: ngang pa dang / byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su bstan te /
analyzed: ngang pa dang / byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su bstan te /
translated: in the Jataka of the Swan and the Jataka of Great Awakening,

original: lus dang / sems la nye bar gnod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang / sems la nye bar gnod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are of the nature of injuring body and mind.

original: ngang pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rnyis bzung bas lus kyi 'tshe ba la 'jug pa'i gnod pa las bzod pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rnyis bzung bas lus kyi 'tshe ba la 'jug pa'i gnod pa las bzod pa'o //
translated: In the Jataka of the Swan, he forgave the harm of injury to the body by a snare.🔽In the Jataka of Great Awakening, he forgave the harm of injury to the mind by the king's men.

original: byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni sems la gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni sems la gnod pa yin te /
translated: In the Jataka of the Great Awakening, it is mental harm.

original: brnyas pas nye bar gtses pas 'jug pa'i gnod pa la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: brnyas pas nye bar gtses pas 'jug pa'i gnod pa la bzod pa'o //
translated: It is patience with the harm of engaging in contempt.

original: gsod pa'i gnod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas skyes pa'i rabs lhag ma bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gsod pa'i gnod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas skyes pa'i rabs lhag ma bzhi yin te /
translated: The remaining four Jatakas are from the perspective of the harm of killing.

original: gsod pa'i gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsod pa'i gnod pa byed pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The harm of killing is also of two types:

original: gsod pa'i gnod pa byed par sbyor ba dang / gsod pa'i gnod par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i gnod pa byed par sbyor ba dang / gsod pa'i gnod par sbyor ba'o //
translated: the harm of engaging in killing and the harm of being engaged in killing.

original: de las gsod par sbyor ba'i gnod pa byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de las gsod par sbyor ba'i gnod pa byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the harm of engaging in killing,

original: sha ra bha dang / ru ru dang / spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs so //
analyzed: sha ra bha dang / ru ru dang / spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs so //
translated: there are the Jatakas of Sarabha, Ruru, and Monkey.

original: de la sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni bdag nyid kyis mda' 'phen pa dang / gnod pa ma byas te /
analyzed: de la sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni bdag nyid kyis mda' 'phen pa dang / gnod pa ma byas te /
translated: In the Jataka of Sarabha, he himself shot an arrow, but he did not harm it.

original: phan btags shing rgyal po la bzod pa ste /
analyzed: phan btags shing rgyal po la bzod pa ste /
translated: He helped it and forgave the king.

original: sbyor ba byed pa la bzod pa pa byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba byed pa la bzod pa pa byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of patience with the engagement.🔽From the perspective of the harm of being engaged in killing,🔽there are the Jatakas of the Hare, the Parrot, and the Rhinoceros.

original: ru ru dang / spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpas de gnyis la phan btags pa yin du zin kyang gnod pa byed par 'jug pa de @325a * //
analyzed: ru ru dang / spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpas de gnyis la phan btags pa yin du zin kyang gnod pa byed par 'jug pa de @325a * //
translated: In the Jataka of the Ruru and the Jataka of the Monkey, the Bodhisattva helped them, but they were induced to do harm.

original: gnyis la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he was patient with them.

original: 'di gnyis la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
translated: There is this difference between the two:

original: ru ru'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' la gsod par sbyor bas sbyor du bcug par bstan te /
analyzed: ru ru'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' la gsod par sbyor bas sbyor du bcug par bstan te /
translated: In the Jataka of the Ruru, the king was induced to apply himself to killing the Bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni gsod par sbyor ba ma brtsams so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni gsod par sbyor ba ma brtsams so //
translated: But he did not himself begin the application to killing.

original: spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpas phan btags pa byas pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis gsod par sbyor ba rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpas phan btags pa byas pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis gsod par sbyor ba rtsom pa'o //
translated: In the Jataka of the Monkey, the Bodhisattva did help them, and then they themselves began the application to killing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ru ru'i skyes pa'i rabs su mthong ba'i chos nyid la lag pa chad par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ru ru'i skyes pa'i rabs su mthong ba'i chos nyid la lag pa chad par ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the Jataka of the Ruru, it is shown that the hand was cut off in the very same life.

original: de bzhin du spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang bdag nyid gsod par rtsom pa yin pas mdze'i nad kyis de ma thag tu zil gyis mnan to //🔽da ni bzod pa smra ba'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni bdag nyid gsod par rtsom pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du spre'u'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang bdag nyid gsod par rtsom pa yin pas mdze'i nad kyis de ma thag tu zil gyis mnan to // da ni bzod pa smra ba'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni bdag nyid gsod par rtsom pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in the Birth Story of the Monkey, he was immediately overcome by leprosy because he was about to kill himself.

original: de ma thag tu rims nad me bzhin 'bar zhes bya ba dang / sa gas nang du zhugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu rims nad me bzhin 'bar zhes bya ba dang / sa gas nang du zhugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in the Birth Story of the Patient Man, he was immediately consumed by a fever like a fire, and the earth split open and swallowed him, because he was about to kill himself.

original: gtsug phud byang chub kyi skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyal po mthong ba'i chos nyid la mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug phud byang chub kyi skyes pa'i rabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyal po mthong ba'i chos nyid la mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa ma thob pa ste /
translated: In the Birth Story of Śikhī, the king who harmed the Bodhisattva did not immediately experience the unpleasant ripening of his action in this life,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba med pa'i phyir dang / khyim thab dang chung ma phal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba med pa'i phyir dang / khyim thab dang chung ma phal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Bodhisattva was free from hatred and because he had no ordinary wife or home.

original: ngang pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan brjod pas phrad par 'dod pa des byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byas kyang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bum thob pa'o //🔽byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rgyal po la sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / ma gus pa nyi tshe tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med do ;
analyzed: ngang pa'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan brjod pas phrad par 'dod pa des byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byas kyang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bum thob pa'o // byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs su ni rgyal po la sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir dang / ma gus pa nyi tshe tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med do ;
translated: In the Jataka of the Gander, there was no evil intention toward the king, and the one who wanted to meet the Bodhisattva through praising his good qualities did not get the result he wanted, even though he harmed the Bodhisattva.🔽In the Jataka of Great Awakening, there was no evil intention toward the king, and there was only disrespect, so there was no undesirable result.

original: / sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang rgyal po la sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / gnod pa'i sbyor ba nyi tshe tsam yod pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed par sbyor ba yang byang chub sems dpa' yin par sngar ma shes pa dang /
analyzed: / sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs su yang rgyal po la sdig pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / gnod pa'i sbyor ba nyi tshe tsam yod pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed par sbyor ba yang byang chub sems dpa' yin par sngar ma shes pa dang /
translated: In the Jataka of Sarabha, there was no evil intention toward the king, and there was only a slight application of harm, and the one who applied the harm to the Bodhisattva did not know that he was a Bodhisattva.

original: rgyal pos gnod pa ma byas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: rgyal pos gnod pa ma byas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med do //
translated: The king did not do any harm, so there was no undesirable result.

original: de nyid kyis 'di dag ni bzod pa chung ba yin pa'i phyir dang por smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'di dag ni bzod pa chung ba yin pa'i phyir dang por smos pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, they are mentioned first, because they have little patience.

original: skyes pa'i rabs 'di dag las gzhan du ru ru dang / spre'u dang / bzod pa smra ba skyes pa'i rabs phyis bkod pa ni go rims bzhin du khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs 'di dag las gzhan du ru ru dang / spre'u dang / bzod pa smra ba skyes pa'i rabs phyis bkod pa ni go rims bzhin du khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The stories of Ruru, the monkey, and Kṣāntivādi are mentioned later in the Jātakas, respectively, because they are more distinguished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' phan @325b btags pa la gnod pa byed pa la phyi ma gsum yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phan @325b btags pa la gnod pa byed pa la phyi ma gsum yin te /
translated: The last three stories are about bodhisattvas who were harmed by those whom they had helped.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yin te /🔽sems kyi go skabs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yin te / sems kyi go skabs med pa nyid do //
translated: They had undesirable results,🔽because they had no opportunity to make amends.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam pa ngan pa med pas spre'u'i tshogs de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' la brdzis pa yin na yang byang chub sems dpas gnang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam pa ngan pa med pas spre'u'i tshogs de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' la brdzis pa yin na yang byang chub sems dpas gnang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva had no malice, so even though the troop of monkeys trampled the bodhisattva, he forgave them.

original: gzhan du ma yin pas mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pas mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: since it is not otherwise, there is no undesirable result.

original: skyes pa'i rabs gzhan dag kyang sems kyi go skabs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs gzhan dag kyang sems kyi go skabs med pa nyid do //
translated: There are other jātakas, too, where there is no opportunity for anger.

original: go rims de ltar bkod par gyur na ni bzod pa bsgoms pa la 'jug pa rnams kyi bzod pa'i rnam pa go rims bzhin du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: go rims de ltar bkod par gyur na ni bzod pa bsgoms pa la 'jug pa rnams kyi bzod pa'i rnam pa go rims bzhin du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: If the order of the jātakas were to be in accordance with the order of the perfections, then the order would be as follows: the monkey jātaka would be first, since it illustrates the perfection of generosity; the hare jātaka would be second, since it illustrates the perfection of morality; the rhinoceros jātaka would be third, since it illustrates the perfection of patience; the monkey king’s jātaka would be fourth, since it illustrates the perfection of effort; the nāga king’s jātaka would be fifth, since it illustrates the perfection of meditation; and the bodhisattva’s jātaka would be sixth, since it illustrates the perfection of wisdom.

original: de sgrub pa'i thabs bstan par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i thabs bstan par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is appropriate to teach the means of accomplishing patience in this order.

original: skyes pa'i rabs 'di dag gi go rims 'di bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs 'di dag gi go rims 'di bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The order of these jātakas should be understood in this way.

original: gal te phyogs su mi 'dzin pa dag yod na yang 'di bzhin du glegs bam dag tu bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te phyogs su mi 'dzin pa dag yod na yang 'di bzhin du glegs bam dag tu bri bar bya'o //
translated: Even if there are those who do not hold to this order, they should write it down in this way in their books.

original: bzod pa'i tshoms te sde tshan gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bzod pa'i tshoms te sde tshan gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The Chapter on Patience is completed.

original: // / ji ltar phrad kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba mngon par 'dod pa'am /🔽dge ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // / ji ltar phrad kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba mngon par 'dod pa'am /🔽dge ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As it says, “Even if they meet, they are not suitable,” meaning that they do not desire nonvirtue or they desire virtue.

original: rab tu grags pa'i rigs dang / dpal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni gtso bo'i nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i rigs dang / dpal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni gtso bo'i nus pa bstan to //
translated: These two, “of well-known lineage” and “endowed with glory,” show the power of the principal.

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin par byed pas 'bangs rnams ni glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsang tshig gi nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin par byed pas 'bangs rnams ni glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsang tshig gi nus pa bstan to //
translated: “The subjects were close to him because he held their welfare at heart” shows the power of his secret speech.

original: gzi byin che bas rgyal phran dregs pa rnams phyag 'tshal bar gyur pa zhes bya bas ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzi byin che bas rgyal phran dregs pa rnams phyag 'tshal bar gyur pa zhes bya bas ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //
translated: “The haughty minor kings paid homage to him because of his great majesty” shows the power of his enthusiasm.

original: yon tan brgya'i 'od zer gyi phreng pa ni yon tan brgya'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan brgya'i 'od zer gyi phreng pa ni yon tan brgya'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba'o //
translated: “A garland of hundreds of light rays of good qualities” is a garland of hundreds of light rays of good qualities.

original: 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa gang la yod pa de ni yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa'o //🔽zla ba bzhin du mthong na dga' ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa gang la yod pa de ni yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa'o // zla ba bzhin du mthong na dga' ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: One who has a hundred light rays is “endowed with a hundred light rays of good qualities.”

original: zla ba dang 'dra bar mthong na dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang 'dra bar mthong na dga' ba'o //
translated: “Delightful to behold like the moon” is delightful to behold like the moon.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: bu zla ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bu zla ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: he is called the son Candraprabha.

original: zla ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir bu zla ba zhes btags te /
analyzed: zla ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir bu zla ba zhes btags te /
translated: Because he was like the moon, he was named Candra, the Moon.

original: de'i ming yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du ston to ;
analyzed: de'i ming yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du ston to ;
translated: This shows that his name was appropriate.

original: / legs par phan 'dogs pa zhes bya bas ni mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams sdang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: / legs par phan 'dogs pa zhes bya bas ni mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams sdang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: By “well-benefiting,” he shows that he did not generate unwholesome states that had not yet arisen and that he abandoned unwholesome states that had arisen.

original: sdud pa la mkhas pa dang / gus pa je che je cher gyur pa dang // zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams phyir zhing @326a * //🔽bsgoms pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdud pa la mkhas pa dang / gus pa je che je cher gyur pa dang // zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams phyir zhing @326a * // bsgoms pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By “skill in synthesis” and “increasing respect,” he shows that he generated wholesome states that had not yet arisen and that he cultivated wholesome states that had arisen.

original: yongs su bskyangs pa la nges par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su bskyangs pa la nges par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By “for the sake of certainty in protection,” he shows that he cultivated wholesome states.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skyes pa'i rabs 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skyes pa'i rabs 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: Therefore, this Jātaka was taught in order to show the perfection of effort.

original: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams spangs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams spangs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: He shows that unarisen unwholesome factors do not arise, and that those which have arisen are abandoned.

original: mi dge ba'i chos spangs pa med par ni dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang / 'phel ba dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spangs pa med par ni dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang / 'phel ba dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without the abandonment of unwholesome factors, there is no arising, growth, or duration of wholesome factors.

original: yon tan gnyen dang 'dra bar gyur to zhes bya ba bstan pa la /
analyzed: yon tan gnyen dang 'dra bar gyur to zhes bya ba bstan pa la /
translated: The qualities are like relatives.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen de gang yin zhe na ;
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen de gang yin zhe na ;
translated: What are the relatives of beings?

original: gnyen dang 'dra ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen dang 'dra ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that they are like relatives, he says:

original: tshul khrims thos dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims thos dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Morality, learning, generosity, and self-control.

original: yang na gzhan dang mngon par 'brel pas yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa zhes bshad pa'i yon tan gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na gzhan dang mngon par 'brel pas yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa zhes bshad pa'i yon tan gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Or else, what are the qualities that were explained as being endowed with a hundred rays of light, in the sense of being connected with others?

original: tshul khrims thos dang gtong dang snying rje dul //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims thos dang gtong dang snying rje dul //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Morality, learning, generosity, and self-control.

original: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni yon tan gzhan dag yang ldan pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni yon tan gzhan dag yang ldan pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that he also possesses other qualities.

original: yon tan yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “the existence of the qualities” means the existence of the very qualities themselves.

original: de'i yon tan mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yon tan mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he possesses many of them.

original: lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa bzhin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is adorned with the ornaments of youth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i lang tsho bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i lang tsho bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The phrase “adorned with the ornaments of youth” means that he is adorned with the ornaments of a bodhisattva.

original: lang tsho ni da ltar byung ba'i yon tan gyis mdzes pa yin te /
analyzed: lang tsho ni da ltar byung ba'i yon tan gyis mdzes pa yin te /
translated: Youth is made beautiful by the qualities that are present in the present.

original: de bas na yon tan lang tsho'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan lang tsho'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the qualities are like the ornaments of youth.

original: yang na lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa bzhin du yon tan gsar pa dag gis rab tu brgyan pa ste ;
analyzed: yang na lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa bzhin du yon tan gsar pa dag gis rab tu brgyan pa ste ;
translated: Alternatively, the phrase “adorned with the ornaments of youth” means that he is adorned with the new qualities that are like ornaments.

original: de bas na lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na lang tshor gyur pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be “adorned with the ornaments of youth.”

original: rnam par dag pa yang yin la rgya che ba yang yin pas rnam par dag cing rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang yin la rgya che ba yang yin pas rnam par dag cing rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is both pure and vast, thus it is pure and vast.

original: rnam par dag pa dang / rgya che ba gnyis kyis yid du 'ong ba de ni rnam par dag cing rgya che yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang / rgya che ba gnyis kyis yid du 'ong ba de ni rnam par dag cing rgya che yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: It is pleasing because it is both pure and vast.

original: de bzhin du de'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: Its qualities are also like that.

original: gnas su gyur ces bya ba 'dis ni yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas su gyur ces bya ba 'dis ni yon tan gyi 'od zer brgya dang ldan pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is a basis because it is a basis endowed with the light of a hundred qualities.

original: 'dis ni gsang tshig gi nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsang tshig gi nus pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the power of the king's word.

original: 'bangs rnams skyong nus pa dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bangs rnams skyong nus pa dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni spro ba'i nus pa bstan to //
translated: He is able to protect his subjects shows his power of enthusiasm.

original: ma 'jungs shing rang bzhin bzang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @326b 'dis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma 'jungs shing rang bzhin bzang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @326b 'dis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Because he is not avaricious and is of good nature shows the perfection of his cause.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang sa bon zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang sa bon zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Nature, cause, and seed are not different in meaning.

original: 'dis ni de nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of his nature.

original: dang po 'di gnyis kyis ni skyes bu'i byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po 'di gnyis kyis ni skyes bu'i byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The first two of these are the perfection of human action.

original: rgyal tshab kyi longs spyod ces bya ba ni bdag po'i nus pa byed du bcug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal tshab kyi longs spyod ces bya ba ni bdag po'i nus pa byed du bcug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The enjoyment of the regent is the enjoyment of the king's power.

original: rab tu mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i thos pa dang / shes rab dang / yid gzhungs shing mngon par brtson pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rab tu mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i thos pa dang / shes rab dang / yid gzhungs shing mngon par brtson pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The wise man is one who is endowed with learning, wisdom, and mental agility, as previously explained, and who is engaged in striving.

original: mkhas pas chos ldan zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dod pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pas chos ldan zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dod pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The righteous man is one who is endowed with the meaning, the desire, and the power.

original: legs par smra ba la ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: legs par smra ba la ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: How does he act in regard to good speech?

original: mchod pa khyad par can gyis zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mchod pa khyad par can gyis zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: By means of special worship.

original: des na de nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: des na de nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: For that very reason,

original: legs par bshad pa la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he delights in good speech.🔽When the season of spring has arrived,

original: dpyid zla'i dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni me tog 'byung ba'i dus kyi zla ba la bab pa'o //
analyzed: dpyid zla'i dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni me tog 'byung ba'i dus kyi zla ba la bab pa'o //
translated: the trees put forth flowers.

original: shing lo rnams mdzes shing 'jam por gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni dpyid zla'i dus la bab pa'i mthus shing lo rnams mdzes shing 'jam por gyur pa'o //🔽me tog nyid kha 'bus pas sdug cing /
analyzed: shing lo rnams mdzes shing 'jam por gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni dpyid zla'i dus la bab pa'i mthus shing lo rnams mdzes shing 'jam por gyur pa'o // me tog nyid kha 'bus pas sdug cing /
translated: The trees are beautiful and soft because of the power of the spring season.🔽The flowers are beautiful because of the opening of the flowers.

original: dgod pa ltar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni me tog sdug gu kha 'bus pa rnams ni dgod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgod pa ltar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni me tog sdug gu kha 'bus pa rnams ni dgod pa bzhin no //
translated: The flowers are beautiful because of the opening of the flowers.

original: ne'u gsing sngon po ni ne'u gsing sngon po'o //
analyzed: ne'u gsing sngon po ni ne'u gsing sngon po'o //
translated: The green grass is the green grass.

original: de nyid kyi ri mo bkram pa lta bu yin pas ne'u gsing sngon po gsar pa rnams kyis ri mo bkram pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ri mo bkram pa lta bu yin pas ne'u gsing sngon po gsar pa rnams kyis ri mo bkram pa'o //
translated: The new green grass is like a spread-out painting because of the spread-out pattern of the new green grass.

original: des sa gzhi mdzes par byas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des sa gzhi mdzes par byas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The ground is beautiful because of the new green grass.

original: sa gzhi ne'u gsing sngon po gsar bu rnams kyis ri mo bkram pa bzhin du mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi ne'u gsing sngon po gsar bu rnams kyis ri mo bkram pa bzhin du mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: The ground is beautiful because of the new green grass.

original: yid dga' ba 'byung ba yin pas yid dga' ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yid dga' ba 'byung ba yin pas yid dga' ba skyes pa'o //
translated: The mind is joyful because of the arising of mental joy.

original: skyed mos tshal na lding khang yod pa de ni lding khang skyed mos tshal lo //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal na lding khang yod pa de ni lding khang skyed mos tshal lo //
translated: The pleasure grove that has a pleasure house is the pleasure grove with a pleasure house.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i lding khang gi rgyan skyed mos tshal gang la yod pa de ni lding khang rgyan can skyed mos tshal lo //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i lding khang gi rgyan skyed mos tshal gang la yod pa de ni lding khang rgyan can skyed mos tshal lo //
translated: The pleasure grove that has a pleasure house with beautiful adornments is the pleasure grove with an adorned pleasure house.

original: bud med rnams kyi glu sgra snyan dang 'brel //
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi glu sgra snyan dang 'brel //
translated: The pleasure grove that is associated with the sweet sounds of women singing

original: zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i yul gyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //🔽'dzum la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul gyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i yul gyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o // 'dzum la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul gyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: is from the perspective of the enjoyment of the object of the ear.🔽The pleasure grove that is skilled in smiling is from the perspective of the enjoyment of the object of the eye.

original: yan lag mdzes par bsgyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag mdzes par bsgyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The pleasure grove that is adorned with beautiful limbs is from the perspective of the enjoyment of the object of touch.

original: bzang mo mdzes par zhes bya ba ni longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bzang mo mdzes par zhes bya ba ni longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The pleasure grove that is beautiful and lovely is from the perspective of the enjoyment of wealth.

original: de ltar 'di dag gis ni sems can gyi longs spyod kyi rkyen bstan pa'o //🔽da ni sems @327a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag gis ni sems can gyi longs spyod kyi rkyen bstan pa'o // da ni sems @327a * //
translated: Thus, these are the conditions for the enjoyment of sentient beings.

original: can ma yin pa'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: can ma yin pa'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the enjoyment of non-sentient beings,🔽it is said:

original: skyed mos tshal bzang de na de ni dga' bar gnas //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal bzang de na de ni dga' bar gnas //
translated: He delights in that excellent garden.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna'i longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the point of view of the enjoyment of the eye, ear, and nose.

original: lang tsho la bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'dod pa'i yul la chags pa nyid du ston to ;
analyzed: lang tsho la bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'dod pa'i yul la chags pa nyid du ston to ;
translated: “In the prime of youth” shows that he is attached to the objects of his desires.

original: / bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: / bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa ste /
translated: “Arisen from the power of the perfection of merit” shows that he is distinguished by the perfection of merit from generosity, morality, etc.

original: de'i mthu ni bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: de'i mthu ni bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: “Power” is the power of the perfection of merit.

original: de las byung ba ni bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'i mthu las byung ba ste /
translated: “Arisen from that” means arisen from the power of the perfection of merit.

original: 'dis ni 'bad pa med par byung ba nyid de rgyu'i stobs las byung ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bad pa med par byung ba nyid de rgyu'i stobs las byung ba nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that he is arisen without effort, arisen by the power of his cause.

original: rol mo'i dga' ba la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni sngar skyes pa'i dga' ba nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: rol mo'i dga' ba la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni sngar skyes pa'i dga' ba nyams pa yin te /
translated: “The joy of music is destroyed” means that the joy already arisen is destroyed.

original: bud med dang skyes pa rnams kyi bstan nas /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa rnams kyi bstan nas /
translated: Women and men are taught.

original: da ni bud med kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni bud med kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, with reference to women,

original: bud med gzhon nu rnams 'jigs shing bag 'khums par byed pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: bud med gzhon nu rnams 'jigs shing bag 'khums par byed pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: it is taught by “terrifying and humiliating young women.”

original: mi'i stobs dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa las 'das pa gang la yod pa de ni stobs dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa mi pas lhag pa'o //🔽srin po dag pas kyang lhag par mi bzad pa'i gzugs gang la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: mi'i stobs dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa las 'das pa gang la yod pa de ni stobs dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa mi pas lhag pa'o // srin po dag pas kyang lhag par mi bzad pa'i gzugs gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has power, strength, and so on, surpassing that of humans is “more powerful than humans.”

original: srin po bas kyang lhag par mi bzad pa'i gzugs can no /🔽shing rta dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / dmag mi brtan pa nyams par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: srin po bas kyang lhag par mi bzad pa'i gzugs can no / shing rta dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / dmag mi brtan pa nyams par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which has a form more terrifying than that of rākṣasas is “having a form more terrifying than rākṣasas.”

original: shing rta dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / dmag mi brtan pa nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / dmag mi brtan pa nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: That which destroys chariots, horses, elephants, and strong soldiers is “destroying chariots, horses, elephants, and strong soldiers.”

original: ci legs mdzad pa ni go cha bgo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci legs mdzad pa ni go cha bgo ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is well done is the donning of armor and so on.

original: ngang tshul gyi skyon shes pa gang yin pa de ni de ste /
analyzed: ngang tshul gyi skyon shes pa gang yin pa de ni de ste /
translated: That is, the one who knows the fault of his own nature.

original: ngang tshul gyi skyon ni ma bsngags pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: ngang tshul gyi skyon ni ma bsngags pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The fault of one's own nature is the thing that is not praised.

original: sngar chab sgo pas bsten pa'i ste /🔽lha de las ci legs par mdzad cing bka' gros mdzad pa'i dus la bab po zhes gsol to zhes bya ba de gnyi ga dus la bab pa nyid du bstan pa de'i de ltar mi bya ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar chab sgo pas bsten pa'i ste / lha de las ci legs par mdzad cing bka' gros mdzad pa'i dus la bab po zhes gsol to zhes bya ba de gnyi ga dus la bab pa nyid du bstan pa de'i de ltar mi bya ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The doorkeeper said,🔽The time has come for you to do what is best for the god and to consult with him.

original: mi sha 'dod pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis brgal ba'i go skabs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos so //
analyzed: mi sha 'dod pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis brgal ba'i go skabs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos so //
translated: The two verses beginning with He who desires human flesh and The opportunity to dispute with me were spoken in order to show that the time has come for both of them.

original: mi sha 'dod pas rgyal srid nyams par gyur //
analyzed: mi sha 'dod pas rgyal srid nyams par gyur //
translated: He who desires human flesh will lose his kingdom.

original: zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa nyams pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'dod pa nyams pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the fault of desire itself.

original: smyos pa lta bur gyur pa ni smyos pa bzhin du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: smyos pa lta bur gyur pa ni smyos pa bzhin du gyur pa ste /
translated: He is like one who is insane means he is like one who is mad.

original: smyos pa @327b zhes bya ba 'dis ni don nyams pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: smyos pa @327b zhes bya ba 'dis ni don nyams pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Insane shows the fault of the object.

original: rang gi chos btang zhes bya bas ni chos yongs su spangs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rang gi chos btang zhes bya bas ni chos yongs su spangs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: By the words “he abandons his own Dharma” he shows the complete abandonment of the Dharma.

original: rang gi chos btang ba nyid kyis bsod nams dang grags pa yang nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi chos btang ba nyid kyis bsod nams dang grags pa yang nyams pa nyid do //
translated: And by abandoning his own Dharma, he loses both merit and fame.

original: 'dir bsod nams zhes smos pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu la dgongs te /
analyzed: 'dir bsod nams zhes smos pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu la dgongs te /
translated: Here, the mention of “merit” is intended to refer to the result of the accumulation of merit.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu nyams pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu nyams pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the loss of the result of high status in the next world.

original: grags pa zhes smos pas ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyams pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: grags pa zhes smos pas ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyams pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The mention of “fame” shows the loss of the result in this world.

original: mya ngan bya ba'i gnas skabs gnas pa la //
analyzed: mya ngan bya ba'i gnas skabs gnas pa la //
translated: He remains in a state of grief

original: zhes bya ba'i rgyu bzhi po de dag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rgyu bzhi po de dag nyid kyis so //
translated: because of those very four causes.

original: bdag gis brgal ba'i sgo skabs gal yod //
analyzed: bdag gis brgal ba'i sgo skabs gal yod //
translated: “I have a question for you, O god.”

original: ces bya bas ni lha de la ci legs par mdzad par gsol zhes bya ba de'i lan no //
analyzed: ces bya bas ni lha de la ci legs par mdzad par gsol zhes bya ba de'i lan no //
translated: This is the reply to the god’s question, “What can I do for you?”

original: de lta bu la 'jigs su ga la rung //
analyzed: de lta bu la 'jigs su ga la rung //
translated: “How could one like me be afraid of such a thing?”

original: zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bka' gros mdzad pa'i dus la bab po zhes bya ba de'i lan bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bka' gros mdzad pa'i dus la bab po zhes bya ba de'i lan bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the reply to the question, “When is the time for consultation as previously taught?”

original: 'thab mo med pas na 'thab mo med pa'o//
analyzed: 'thab mo med pas na 'thab mo med pa'o//
translated: Without strife means without strife.

original: 'thab mo yang yin la brgal ba yang yin pas 'thab mo brgal ba ste des so //
analyzed: 'thab mo yang yin la brgal ba yang yin pas 'thab mo brgal ba ste des so //
translated: Since there is both strife and argument, there is strife and argument.

original: mngon du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las so //
analyzed: mngon du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las so //
translated: In the presence means in the presence.

original: rjes su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni sdig pa gzhom pa la'o //
analyzed: rjes su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni sdig pa gzhom pa la'o //
translated: In order to be taken care of means in order to destroy evil.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni bdag gi drung du kho dag 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bdag gi drung du kho dag 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From that means from that, because they come to me.

original: dam pa rnams ni de ltar mgron yang byed //
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni de ltar mgron yang byed //
translated: The good do this even when invited.

original: ces bya ba snying rje dang ldan pa rnams mgron byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba snying rje dang ldan pa rnams mgron byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: This is the way of those who are compassionate and invite.

original: mi dga' zhing yid blong bas mig mchi mas gang ba de ni mi dga' zhing yid blong bas mig mchi mas gang ba'o //
analyzed: mi dga' zhing yid blong bas mig mchi mas gang ba de ni mi dga' zhing yid blong bas mig mchi mas gang ba'o //
translated: With eyes filled with tears of sorrow and dejection means with eyes filled with tears of sorrow and dejection.

original: dri ma can gyi gos bsrings te /
analyzed: dri ma can gyi gos bsrings te /
translated: Having extended a dirty garment,

original: rked pa bcings pa gang yin pa de ni gos dri ma can bsrings te rked pa bcings pa'o//🔽rdul gyis gos shing ring la yegs pa de la shing shun gyi thod kyis bcings pa ste /
analyzed: rked pa bcings pa gang yin pa de ni gos dri ma can bsrings te rked pa bcings pa'o// rdul gyis gos shing ring la yegs pa de la shing shun gyi thod kyis bcings pa ste /
translated: The one who tied his waist is the one who tied his waist with a dirty garment.

original: rdul gyis gos shing rtsub pas ring zhing yegs pa'i skra gang yin pa de shing shun gyi thod kyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rdul gyis gos shing rtsub pas ring zhing yegs pa'i skra gang yin pa de shing shun gyi thod kyis bcings pa'o //
translated: The one who was covered with dust and had long, disheveled hair is the one who tied his hair with a bark turban.🔽The one who had long, disheveled hair covered with dust is the one who tied his hair with a bark turban.

original: kha spu ring po 'dzings pa des gdong ngams  gang par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gdong gi kha spu ring pos ngams  gnag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kha spu ring po 'dzings pa des gdong ngams  gang par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gdong gi kha spu ring pos ngams  gnag par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one whose long, matted beard covered his face is the one whose long beard on his face was dark.

original: khros pa dang rngam pa ni khros shing rngam pa'o //
analyzed: khros pa dang rngam pa ni khros shing rngam pa'o //
translated: The one who was angry and fierce is the one who was angry and fierce.

original: bgrad pa dang 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa ni bgrad pa dang 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: bgrad pa dang 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa ni bgrad pa dang 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa ste /
translated: The one who was glaring and terrifying is the one who was glaring and terrifying.

original: khros shing rngam pa gnyis kyis bgrad pa'i mig gang la yod pa de ni khros shing rngam pas mig bgrad pa'o //
analyzed: khros shing rngam pa gnyis kyis bgrad pa'i mig gang la yod pa de ni khros shing rngam pas mig bgrad pa'o //
translated: The one who had glaring eyes due to being angry and fierce is the one who had glaring eyes due to being angry and fierce.

original: @328a * // gcig pu phub dang mtshon med ces bya bas ni su d'a sa'i bu la sngar bstan pa'i brgal ba med pa nyid du bstan pa'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis zhi bar snang ba zhes bya bas ni sngar bstan pa 'di lta bu la 'jigs su ga la rung zhes bya ba de ston pa ste /
analyzed: @328a * // gcig pu phub dang mtshon med ces bya bas ni su d'a sa'i bu la sngar bstan pa'i brgal ba med pa nyid du bstan pa'o // rang bzhin gyis zhi bar snang ba zhes bya bas ni sngar bstan pa 'di lta bu la 'jigs su ga la rung zhes bya ba de ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase without a single robe or weapon indicates that the son of Sudāsa is not subject to the objections raised earlier.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase he appears to be naturally peaceful indicates that it is not right to be afraid of someone like him, as was explained earlier, because he is not a source of fear.

original: rngam pa dang dregs pa gnyis kyis g-yengs pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems rngam zhing dregs pas g-yengs pa'o //🔽srin po dang yi dags gar byed pa bzhin du 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: rngam pa dang dregs pa gnyis kyis g-yengs pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems rngam zhing dregs pas g-yengs pa'o // srin po dang yi dags gar byed pa bzhin du 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The phrase his mind is agitated by excitement and pride indicates that his mind is agitated by excitement and pride.

original: srin po dang yi dags gar byed pa bzhin du 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: srin po dang yi dags gar byed pa bzhin du 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is terrifying like a demon or a ghost indicates that he is terrifying like a demon or a ghost.

original: 'dod pa ni nor la sogs pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni nor la sogs pa la chags pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is greedy for wealth and so on indicates that he is greedy for wealth and so on.

original: shir dogs pa ni srog gi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: shir dogs pa ni srog gi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is afraid of death indicates that he is afraid of death.

original: ya rabs ni bden pa la sogs dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni de bas na 'dod pa la sogs pa'i phyir yongs su mi gtong bas so //
analyzed: ya rabs ni bden pa la sogs dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni de bas na 'dod pa la sogs pa'i phyir yongs su mi gtong bas so //
translated: The noble ones do not abandon truth and so on for the sake of desire and so on.

original: dam pa rnams ni bden pa srog gi phyir yang mi gtong ste /
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni bden pa srog gi phyir yang mi gtong ste /
translated: The noble ones do not abandon truth even for the sake of their lives.

original: ji ltar mi gtong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gtong zhe na /
translated: How do they not abandon it?

original: de'i phyir bden pa dang 'byor pa'i don de bde ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa dang 'byor pa'i don de bde ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of truth and prosperity is happiness.

original: bden pa nyams na ni ngan 'gro dag las srun mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa nyams na ni ngan 'gro dag las srun mi nus pa yin te /
translated: If truth is lost, one cannot be saved from the lower realms.

original: ji ltar dam pa rnams kyi bden pa srog dang 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dam pa rnams kyi bden pa srog dang 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is truth like life for the noble ones?

original: smras pa / gson zhing bden pa nyams pa ni ngan 'gro las srun mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / gson zhing bden pa nyams pa ni ngan 'gro las srun mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: One who is alive but has lost truth cannot be saved from the lower realms.

original: de'i phyir nor dang srog dag las mi nus shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir nor dang srog dag las mi nus shing /
translated: Therefore, one cannot be saved from wealth and life.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su yid la gcags te 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su yid la gcags te 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of death, one dies with regret.

original: grags pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Fame is the truth of the present life.

original: bde ba ni mtho ris su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mtho ris su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Happiness is going to the higher realms.

original: gya gyu tshul zhig pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gya gyu tshul zhig gal te mthong gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gya gyu tshul zhig pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gya gyu tshul zhig gal te mthong gyur pa'o //
translated: That which sees the destruction of the mode of crookedness is the seeing of the destruction of the mode of crookedness.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis 'gal ba yin pas snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis 'khrul par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis 'gal ba yin pas snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis 'khrul par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The former and latter two are contradictory, because the former and latter two appear as confused.

original: gang du legs par spyod pa ma mthong ba de ni legs par spyod pa gal te ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang du legs par spyod pa ma mthong ba de ni legs par spyod pa gal te ma mthong ba ste /
translated: That which does not see good conduct is the not seeing of good conduct.

original: dge ba'i chos ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the not seeing of virtuous dharmas.

original: rgyu gsum gyis ni slar bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ni slar bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For three reasons, one does not turn back:

original: khyod la 'jigs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: khyod la 'jigs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because of fear of you,

original: bde ba la chags pa'am khyod la snying rje med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la chags pa'am khyod la snying rje med par gyur pa ste /
translated: because of attachment to pleasure, or because of lack of compassion for you.

original: rgyu gsum po 'di dag ni yod par gyur na ni phub dang / mtshon cha med par khyod kyi gan du 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di dag ni yod par gyur na ni phub dang / mtshon cha med par khyod kyi gan du 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If these three reasons exist, then one does not come to you without armor and weapons.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir sngar nyid mi 'ong ba nyid do de bas na de nyid du 'ong ba'i rgyu nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir sngar nyid mi 'ong ba nyid do de bas na de nyid du 'ong ba'i rgyu nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since he did not come before, you should understand that he will come for that very reason.

original: bram ze de'i don byas nas slar yang nga bdag khyod kyi drung du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bram ze de'i don byas nas slar yang nga bdag khyod kyi drung du 'ong ngo //
translated: Having accomplished the purpose of that brahmin, I will come back to you.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod dang lhan cig @328b bshes shing 'dris pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir bdag cag lta bu ni de lta bu'i brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba de'i phyir ro //🔽de la mgu bar bya ba ni legs par smra ba de la legs par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dang lhan cig @328b bshes shing 'dris pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir bdag cag lta bu ni de lta bu'i brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba de'i phyir ro // de la mgu bar bya ba ni legs par smra ba de la legs par sbyin pa'o //
translated: Because I am your friend and companion, and because people like us do not speak such false words.🔽There, pleasing is giving well-spoken words.

original: tshig snyan pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i sbyin pa la gang gis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig snyan pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i sbyin pa la gang gis mchod pa'o //
translated: Sweet speech is what is offered to the giver of well-spoken words.

original: bkur sti ni legs par bshad pa ston pa la lus kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni legs par bshad pa ston pa la lus kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: Respect is physical worship of the one who teaches well-spoken words.

original: tshigs bcad gcig la srang stong du byas par ston te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gcig la srang stong du byas par ston te /
translated: One verse is made a thousand ounces.

original: de'i thad du brtsis pa zhes smos pa ni de dang tshad mnyam pa'i nor bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i thad du brtsis pa zhes smos pa ni de dang tshad mnyam pa'i nor bzhag ste /
translated: The phrase in that regard means placing wealth equal to that.

original: gser la sogs pa gal te 'dod pas de la mchod par byas so //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa gal te 'dod pas de la mchod par byas so //
translated: If he desires gold, etc., he should worship it.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gnas ma yin pa la lhag par god pa ni gnas ma yin pa gong tshabs che ba'o //🔽de las bzlog pa ni gnas ma yin par gong tshangs che ba de la dgag par rtsol ba'i sems te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la lhag par god pa ni gnas ma yin pa gong tshabs che ba'o // de las bzlog pa ni gnas ma yin par gong tshangs che ba de la dgag par rtsol ba'i sems te /
translated: Excessive loss in an inappropriate manner is loss in an inappropriate manner to a high degree.🔽The opposite of that is loss in an appropriate manner to a high degree.

original: gnas ma yin par god tshabs che ba dgag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin par god tshabs che ba dgag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought that strives to prevent that is the thought of preventing loss in an inappropriate manner to a high degree.

original: legs par shes par bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: legs par shes par bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: It is proper to know well.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bangs mang po gso dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bangs mang po gso dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he must support many people.

original: rgyal po'i dpal yang nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir god pa tshad dang ldan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpal yang nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir god pa tshad dang ldan par bya ba yin te /
translated: Because the king's glory depends on the abundance of his wealth, he should have a proper loss.

original: 'di ltar tshigs bcad gcig la srang stong du byas te byin pas nor gyi dbang phyug gi nor yang zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshigs bcad gcig la srang stong du byas te byin pas nor gyi dbang phyug gi nor yang zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by giving a single verse at a value of one thousand ounces of gold, the wealth of Kubera, the lord of wealth, would be exhausted.

original: 'bangs mang po gso dgos so zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: 'bangs mang po gso dgos so zhes bstan pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he must support many people, he says:

original: de ni mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mi nus pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is impossible,

original: sbyin pa drags na zhes bya ba'i phyed dang po smos te /
analyzed: sbyin pa drags na zhes bya ba'i phyed dang po smos te /
translated: the first half of the verse beginning with “If he gives too much” is stated.

original: nor gyi dbang phyug gi nor yod pa yang ji srid cig tu thug par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa 'dis ni nor med pa nyid du bstan to /
analyzed: nor gyi dbang phyug gi nor yod pa yang ji srid cig tu thug par 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa 'dis ni nor med pa nyid du bstan to /
translated: This shows that the king’s wealth is not inexhaustible.

original: nor med na ni 'bangs mang po gso bar bya ba de mi nus pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: nor med na ni 'bangs mang po gso bar bya ba de mi nus pa nyid du ston to //
translated: If he has no wealth, he cannot support his many subjects.

original: rgyal po'i dpal yang nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos so zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir /🔽nor dang rab tu ldan na bsgrub par nus //
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpal yang nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos so zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir / nor dang rab tu ldan na bsgrub par nus //
translated: In order to prove that the king’s glory depends on the wealth of his people,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse “If he has wealth, he can accomplish his goals” is stated.

original: rgyal po'i dpal nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpal nor phun sum tshogs pa la ltos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does the king’s glory depend on the wealth of his people?

original: nor dang rab tu ldan na bsgrub par nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nor dang rab tu ldan na bsgrub par nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if he has wealth, he can accomplish his goals.

original: gang la nor yod pa de la rgyal po'i dpal yod de /
analyzed: gang la nor yod pa de la rgyal po'i dpal yod de /
translated: Whoever has wealth has the glory of a king.

original: de ltar na nor yod pa nyid kyis rgyal po'i dpal yod pa nyid du bstan to //🔽nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na nor yod pa nyid kyis rgyal po'i dpal yod pa nyid du bstan to // nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus, it is shown that the king's glory exists because of the existence of wealth.

original: nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal de yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed 'og ma'o //🔽de ltar 'di gnyis kyis de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rgyun can gyi mtshan @329a * //
analyzed: nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal de yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed 'og ma'o // de ltar 'di gnyis kyis de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rgyun can gyi mtshan @329a * //
translated: In the absence of wealth, the king's glory is absent. This is the meaning of the second half of the verse: In the absence of wealth, the king's glory is also absent.

original: nyid du bstan to //🔽legs par smras pa'i mchod pa mang na brgya //🔽de las mang na nus par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: nyid du bstan to // legs par smras pa'i mchod pa mang na brgya // de las mang na nus par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Thus, these two verses show the characteristic of cause and effect because the glory exists when there is wealth and does not exist when there is not.

original: zhes bya ba rgyal pos smras pa de'i lan las brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyal pos smras pa de'i lan las brtsams te /
translated: The king said, If there is much praise of good speech, it is a hundred; if it is more than that, it is not possible.

original: legs par smras pa rnams kyi rin thang zhig / ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //🔽rin thang gi tshad ni rin thang nges pa ste /
analyzed: legs par smras pa rnams kyi rin thang zhig / ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so // rin thang gi tshad ni rin thang nges pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning The value of good speech is stated in response to that.🔽Value is a definite value.

original: rin thang gi tshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rin thang gi tshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The measure of value is the meaning of value.

original: khyod kyang dma' bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyang dma' bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: How can you be low?

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is what is meant.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: legs par bshad pa la mchod pa sbyin par bya ba'i don du ni rgyal srid kyang ring du mchod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa la mchod pa sbyin par bya ba'i don du ni rgyal srid kyang ring du mchod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even a kingdom is not a sufficient offering for the gift of good advice.

original: rin thang bcad par mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rin thang bcad par mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason why it is impossible to set a price on good advice, he says:

original: gang zhig thos nas yid ni zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig thos nas yid ni zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Having heard which, the mind is filled with faith.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dge ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dge ba'i phyir /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is that good advice is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: legs par bshad pa'i rin nges par bcad du mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa'i rin nges par bcad du mi rung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is impossible to set a price on good advice.

original: thog mar dge ba gang zhe na /🔽thos shing nyan pa'i tshe na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba gang zhe na / thos shing nyan pa'i tshe na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: What is virtuous in the beginning?

original: de yang / gang zhig thos nas yid ni dad 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de yang / gang zhig thos nas yid ni dad 'gyur ba //
translated: When it is heard and studied, the mind is filled with faith.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is demonstrated by the line:🔽Having heard which, the mind is filled with faith.

original: bar du dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar du dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtuous in the middle?

original: bsam pa dang ldan zhing nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang ldan zhing nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with reflection and is present.

original: bsam pas bsams pa de ni legs par dga' la brten par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pas bsams pa de ni legs par dga' la brten par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is thought is well-pleasing and is based on the thought.

original: tha mar dge ba gang zhe na ;
analyzed: tha mar dge ba gang zhe na ;
translated: What is virtuous in the end?

original: bsgoms pa des shes rab skye zhing gti mug med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa des shes rab skye zhing gti mug med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Through that cultivation, wisdom arises and delusion is eliminated.

original: gti mug ni ma rig pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug ni ma rig pa spangs pa ste /
translated: Delusion is the elimination of ignorance.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir yang bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽rang gi shas kyang de ni nyo ba'i rigs //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir yang bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro // rang gi shas kyang de ni nyo ba'i rigs //
translated: Because it is eliminated, one has done what should be done.🔽One should even sell one's flesh for it.

original: zhes bya ba ni nang gi lus kyis kyang nyo bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nang gi lus kyis kyang nyo bar bya ba yin na /
translated: This means that if one should even sell one's own flesh for it,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: what need is there to mention external things?

original: thos pa gti mug ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa gti mug ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This verse on learning as the dispeller of delusion is from the perspective of being in accord with supramundane qualities.

original: gti mug mun sel zhes bya bas ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyus mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa ma rig pa spong ba'i gnyen po thos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug mun sel zhes bya bas ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyus mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa ma rig pa spong ba'i gnyen po thos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It says dispeller of the darkness of delusion because learning is not the cause of the path of seeing, nor is it the antidote that eliminates ignorance, which is incompatible with the path of seeing.

original: thos pa ni sgron ma'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni sgron ma'o //
translated: Learning is a lamp.

original: thos pa ni nor gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: thos pa ni nor gyi mchog ste /
translated: Learning is the best of riches,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i nor gyi rgyus de'i tshe dang bshes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i nor gyi rgyus de'i tshe dang bshes pa'o //
translated: for it is the cause of the supramundane noble riches.

original: thos pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgra 'joms pa'i mtshon cha yin te /
analyzed: thos pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgra 'joms pa'i mtshon cha yin te /
translated: Learning is a weapon that destroys the darkness of delusion,

original: bsgom pa'i lam gang gi bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir @329b ro ;🔽/ thos pa ni /🔽thabs tshul man ngag ston pa'i grogs kyi mchog //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gang gi bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir @329b ro ; / thos pa ni / thabs tshul man ngag ston pa'i grogs kyi mchog //
translated: for it eliminates the afflictions along with their latent impressions on the path of meditation.🔽Learning is the best of friends,

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: for it teaches the methods, means, and instructions.

original: de la lhag par bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar sgrub pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa med par thos pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i thabs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar sgrub pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa med par thos pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam bsgrub pa'i thabs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the accomplishment of the path of meditation, which is the elimination of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of meditation, is the result of learning, without being taught by another, because it teaches the means of accomplishing the path of meditation.🔽Now, with reference to the benefit in this life, he says:

original: da ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la phan 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas phongs par gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: da ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la phan 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas phongs par gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Even in misfortune, learning is helpful.

original: mthong ba'i chos la phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The benefit in this life is also twofold:

original: phongs pa las bzlog pa'i phan 'dogs pa dang / phan yon skyed par byed pa'i phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phongs pa las bzlog pa'i phan 'dogs pa dang / phan yon skyed par byed pa'i phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: the benefit of removing poverty and the benefit of producing good qualities.

original: phongs par gyur kyang mi 'gyur mdza' bo yin //
analyzed: phongs par gyur kyang mi 'gyur mdza' bo yin //
translated: Even in poverty, he is a friend who does not change.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: bcing ba la sogs pa'i phongs pa sel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcing ba la sogs pa'i phongs pa sel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he removes the poverty of bondage, etc.

original: sems kyi nad mya ngan gyi mtshan nyid la thos pa ni sman yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi nad mya ngan gyi mtshan nyid la thos pa ni sman yin te /
translated: Learning is the medicine for the mental illness of sorrow,

original: mya ngan sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it removes sorrow.

original: thos pa ni dpung yin te so sor brtags te yang dag par blangs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi dpung 'jig par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa ni dpung yin te so sor brtags te yang dag par blangs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi dpung 'jig par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: Learning is the army, because it is the cause of destroying the army of faults such as passion, by correctly taking up the analysis of each fault.

original: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyi zil gyis mnan pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa 'joms pas dpung gi mchog go //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyi zil gyis mnan pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa 'joms pas dpung gi mchog go //
translated: Moreover, it is the best army because it conquers faults, since it overpowers the power of each fault such as passion.

original: thos pa ni grags pa dang dpal gyi gter gyi mchog kyang yin te /
analyzed: thos pa ni grags pa dang dpal gyi gter gyi mchog kyang yin te /
translated: Learning is also the supreme treasure of fame and glory.

original: thos pa la nye bar gnas pas na mi bzad pa'i grags pa dang dpal thob pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pa la nye bar gnas pas na mi bzad pa'i grags pa dang dpal thob pa yin no //
translated: Because of the presence of learning, one obtains fame and glory that is not surpassed.

original: da ni thos pa smra bar byed pa rnams kyi phan gdags pa chen po nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thos pa smra bar byed pa rnams kyi phan gdags pa chen po nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the great helpfulness of learning for those who expound it, he says:

original: ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes kyi mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes kyi mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: When one meets with the righteous, it is the best of gains.

original: de la smra ba rnams la thos pa phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ya rabs rnams dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad bzhi smos so //
analyzed: de la smra ba rnams la thos pa phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir / ya rabs rnams dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad bzhi smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the helpfulness of learning for those who expound it, he says:🔽When one meets with the righteous, it is the best of gains.

original: de la tshig bzang por gyur pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la tshig bzang por gyur pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, the good words are of four kinds:

original: rang gi phyogs gnas par byed pa nyid du smra ba'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / legs par bshad pa'i snyan dngags byed pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / chos ston pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bstan bcos kyi rim pa bzhin du shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs gnas par byed pa nyid du smra ba'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / legs par bshad pa'i snyan dngags byed pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / chos ston pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bstan bcos kyi rim pa bzhin du shes pa ste /
translated: One becomes skilled in the speech that establishes one's own position, skilled in the speech that composes poetry with good explanations, skilled in the speech that teaches the Dharma, and one knows the sequence of treatises.

original: tshigs bcad bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽ya rabs rnams dang phrad na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni rang gi phyogs gnas par byed pa smra ba'i @330a * //
analyzed: tshigs bcad bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // ya rabs rnams dang phrad na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni rang gi phyogs gnas par byed pa smra ba'i @330a * //
translated: These are to be connected with the four verses in order.

original: tshig la mkhas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshig la mkhas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This verse on meeting with the righteous is from the point of view of becoming skilled in the speech that establishes one's own position.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshig ni ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshig ni ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Because when one's speech meets with the righteous, it is born,

analyzed: yan lag skyon med pa des 'dod pa'i don sgrub nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because with that faultless limb one is able to accomplish one's desired aim.

original: tshogs kyi nang na mkhas pa dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang na mkhas pa dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: The wise are delighted in the assembly.

original: zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i don rigs par ldan pa des so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i don rigs par ldan pa des so //
translated: coherence of the expressed meaning and the expression.🔽The light of the

translated: adversaries is the light of the adversaries.

analyzed: de rnams kyi ji ltar nyi ma lta bu yin te /
translated: How is it like the sun?🔽Just as the sun outshines the light of the moon and the stars, so too does

analyzed: nyi mas ni zla ba la sogs pa'i 'od zer zil gyis gnon pa bzhin du rang gi phyogs gnas par byed pa'i tshig la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: the wise person outshine the adherents of his own position.🔽By virtue of
