analyzed: rang gi phyogs gnas pa nyid kyis phas kyi rgol ba'i 'od zil gyis mnan par 'gyur ro //
translated: adhering to his own position, he outshines the light of the adversaries.

original: 'gran pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gang dag de la 'gran zhing rgol bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gran pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gang dag de la 'gran zhing rgol bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who are rivals are those who wish to rival and dispute with him.🔽He

original: de rnams kyi grags pa dang / drags sel ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi grags pa dang / drags sel ba yin te /
translated: removes the fame and conceit of those rivals.🔽This is because the rivals

original: 'gran pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i don sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gran pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i don sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are unable to accomplish the desired aim.🔽His eyes and face are radiant,

original: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal gyur cing //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal gyur cing //
translated: and

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni legs par bshad pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni legs par bshad pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This verse is from the point of view of becoming skilled in the words of good advice.

original: mig dang bzhin ni mig dang bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin ni mig dang bzhin no //
translated: Face and eyes are face and eyes.

original: mdangs dang rab tu gsal ba ni mdangs dang rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdangs dang rab tu gsal ba ni mdangs dang rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Radiance and clarity are radiance and clarity.

original: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The face and eyes that have radiance and clarity are the face and eyes that have radiance and clarity.

original: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal ba dang / mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa des rab tu dga' ba ni rab tu dga' bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal ba dang / mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa des rab tu dga' ba ni rab tu dga' bar gyur nas so //
translated: Having become delighted by that radiance and clarity of the face and eyes,

original: yang na mig dang bzhin ni mig dang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na mig dang bzhin ni mig dang bzhin no //
translated: Or, face and eyes are face and eyes.

original: mdangs nyid rab tu gsal ba yin pas mdangs rab tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: mdangs nyid rab tu gsal ba yin pas mdangs rab tu gsal ba ste /
translated: Since radiance itself is clarity, it is radiance and clarity.

original: mig dang bzhin mdangs kyang yin la rab tu gsal ba yang yin pas rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin mdangs kyang yin la rab tu gsal ba yang yin pas rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it is both the radiance of the face and eyes and clarity, it is clarity.

original: lhag par tshim pa yin pas lhag par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: lhag par tshim pa yin pas lhag par dga' ba ste /
translated: Since it is supreme satisfaction, it is supreme delight.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is delighted.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the delight?

original: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang bzhin mdangs rab tu gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: His eyes and face are very clear.

original: mi bshes pa ni ma 'dris pa ste sngar ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mi bshes pa ni ma 'dris pa ste sngar ma mthong ba'o //
translated: A stranger is one who is not acquainted, one who has not been seen before.

original: lag pa'i se gol rngob  pas mgu bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni lag pa'i se gol mgu byed rngob  pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i se gol rngob  pas mgu bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni lag pa'i se gol mgu byed rngob  pa'o //
translated: The clapping of the hands is the delight.

original: chos bstan pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i tshig la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to becoming skilled in the words of the teaching of the Dharma,🔽he says,

original: gtan tshigs don rnams rab tu gsal bar ston //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs don rnams rab tu gsal bar ston // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: The reason is the clear teaching of the meaning.

original: gtan @330b tshigs kyang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas gtan tshigs gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gtan @330b tshigs kyang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas gtan tshigs gsal ba'o //
translated: The reason is a reason and it is clear, thus it is a clear reason.

original: des don ston pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs rab tu gsal bas don rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: des don ston pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs rab tu gsal bas don rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the meaning by it is the clear teaching of the meaning by the clear reason.

original: gtsug lag dang lung rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni gtsug lag lung rnams sna tshogs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag dang lung rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni gtsug lag lung rnams sna tshogs so //
translated: The various scriptures and traditions are the various scriptures and traditions.

original: lung ni man ngag ste /
analyzed: lung ni man ngag ste /
translated: Tradition is instruction.

original: gtsug lag dang / lung sna tshogs ston pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag dang / lung sna tshogs ston pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: and in accordance with the various scriptures and traditions.

original: de ltar re zhig chos ston pas don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig chos ston pas don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the Dharma is shown to be perfect in meaning.

original: mnyen zhing sbyangs pas yid du 'ong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mnyen zhing sbyangs pas yid du 'ong ba'i phyir //
translated: It is pleasing because it is gentle and refined.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: mnyen pa ni sgra snyan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyen pa ni sgra snyan pa'o //
translated: gentle means pleasant sounding.

original: sbyangs pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyangs pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Refined means having the characteristics of sound.

original: sgra snyan pa dang / legs par sbyar ba gnyis kyis yid du 'ong ba ni mnyen zhing sbyangs pa yid du 'ong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra snyan pa dang / legs par sbyar ba gnyis kyis yid du 'ong ba ni mnyen zhing sbyangs pa yid du 'ong ba nyid do //
translated: Pleasing is the pleasantness of both pleasant sound and good composition.

original: de bas na 'dis ni brjod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni brjod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, this shows the perfection of expression.

original: me tog phreng ba ma rnyes bkram pa bzhin //
analyzed: me tog phreng ba ma rnyes bkram pa bzhin //
translated: It is like a garland of flowers, not withered.

original: zhes bya ba ni me tog ma rnyis phung po bzhin no //🔽bstan bcos kyi rim pa bzhin du tshig la mkhas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me tog ma rnyis phung po bzhin no // bstan bcos kyi rim pa bzhin du tshig la mkhas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: It is like a garland of fresh flowers.

original: dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: In accordance with the stages of the treatise, the verse on skill in means is stated from the point of view of one who has become skilled in the words.🔽It is gentle and very clear.

original: dul ba dang rab tu gsal ba ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dul ba dang rab tu gsal ba ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: Well-disciplined and clear means well-disciplined and clear.

original: dul zhing rab tu gsal ba des spobs pa ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: dul zhing rab tu gsal ba des spobs pa ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i spobs pa'o //
translated: The eloquence of that well-disciplined and clear one is the eloquence of the well-disciplined and clear one.

original: de gnyis 'bar ba de ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i spobs pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis 'bar ba de ni dul zhing rab tu gsal ba'i spobs pa skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of that blazing of those two is the arising of the eloquence of the well-disciplined and clear one.

original: dul ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well-disciplined is because of being without afflictions.

original: rab tu gsal ba ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clear is because of being without harm.

original: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: Immediate means overpowering.

original: smra ba legs pa ni lce bde bar gyur pa ste gang bzang po'o //
analyzed: smra ba legs pa ni lce bde bar gyur pa ste gang bzang po'o //
translated: Good speech is the eloquence of the tongue, which is excellent.

original: nga la goms pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nga la goms pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Accustomed to me means possessing.

original: thos pa nyid dpal yin pas thos pa'i dpal lo //
analyzed: thos pa nyid dpal yin pas thos pa'i dpal lo //
translated: The glory of learning is the glory of learning.

original: don gsal bar rtogs par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni don gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don gsal bar rtogs par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni don gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which has the clear understanding of the meaning is the clear understanding of the meaning.

original: de nyid thos pa'i dpal yin pas don gsal rtogs 'gyur thos pa'i dpal lo //
analyzed: de nyid thos pa'i dpal yin pas don gsal rtogs 'gyur thos pa'i dpal lo //
translated: That itself is the glory of learning, so the clear understanding of the meaning is the glory of learning.

original: bsgrub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the cause of accomplishment,

original: thos dang ldan na 'gal ba med pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: thos dang ldan na 'gal ba med pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: The verse beginning with “When there is learning, there is no contradiction” is stated.

original: 'gal ba'i dngos po yin pas 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i dngos po yin pas 'gal lo //
translated: There is a contradiction because of being a contradictory entity.

original: 'gal ba yin la nyes pa yang yin pas 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba yin la nyes pa yang yin pas 'gal ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a contradiction and also a fault, so it is a contradictory fault.

original: da spangs pa ni 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: da spangs pa ni 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of a contradictory fault is the absence of a contradiction.

original: 'khor gsum lam la zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho bde 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum lam la zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho bde 'gro'o //
translated: The path of the three spheres is the path of the higher realms.

original: sgrub pa'i rgyu la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rgyu la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the cause of accomplishment, so it is called “well-established.”

original: ji ltar rab tu gnas pa yin @331a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu gnas pa yin @331a * //
translated: How is it well-established?

original: zhe na ; thos pa'i rjes su 'jug pas bsgrub pa yin pas thos pa'i rjes sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhe na ; thos pa'i rjes su 'jug pas bsgrub pa yin pas thos pa'i rjes sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is established by engaging in learning, so it is the establishment that follows learning.

original: de snying por byed pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa'i rjes 'jug sgrub pa snying por byed pa'o //
analyzed: de snying por byed pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa'i rjes 'jug sgrub pa snying por byed pa'o //
translated: One who makes that essential is one who makes the establishment that follows learning essential.

original: skye ba'i rdzong las tshegs chung thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba'i rdzong las tshegs chung thar bar 'gyur //
translated: One will be liberated from the fortress of birth with little difficulty.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges par legs pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges par legs pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of definite goodness.

original: thos pa'i rjes 'jug sgrub pa snying por byed pa de nyid kyis thar ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i rjes 'jug sgrub pa snying por byed pa de nyid kyis thar ba'o //
translated: Liberation is just that, the practice of what one has heard, making the essence of it.

original: yon tan du ma can zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i yon tan las gzhan dag kyang gzung ste bdag gis nus bzhin du ji ltar thos pa de la mchod pa mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan du ma can zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i yon tan las gzhan dag kyang gzung ste bdag gis nus bzhin du ji ltar thos pa de la mchod pa mi bya ba'o //
translated: Having many virtues means that one should understand that there are other virtues besides those mentioned above, and that one should make offerings to the Dharma as one has heard it, while one is able.

original: khyod kyi bka' yang ci phyir bcag par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi bka' yang ci phyir bcag par 'gyur //
translated: Why should your word be violated?

original: zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: legs par smra ba ston pa la yang mchod pa bya ba mchog tu tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: legs par smra ba ston pa la yang mchod pa bya ba mchog tu tshad ma yin te /
translated: It is supremely reasonable to make offerings to the teacher, the one who speaks well,🔽because there is nothing higher than that.

original: de las mchog tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir dogs pa med pa'i yon tan nyams par 'gyur /🔽skyon gyi lam du zhugs pas 'thob 'gyur ba'i /
analyzed: de las mchog tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir dogs pa med pa'i yon tan nyams par 'gyur / skyon gyi lam du zhugs pas 'thob 'gyur ba'i /
translated: One should not violate the virtue of being free from doubt.

original: rgyal srid spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal srid spyod pa yin te /
translated: The fault of violating the virtue of being free from doubt is that one will obtain a kingdom that is a path to misfortune.

original: de bas na rgyal srid spyod pa bdag la dgos pa med pa'o//
analyzed: de bas na rgyal srid spyod pa bdag la dgos pa med pa'o//
translated: Therefore, I have no need for the enjoyment of a kingdom.

original: su d'a sa'i bu'i drung du 'gro zhes bstan pa de rgyu gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: su d'a sa'i bu'i drung du 'gro zhes bstan pa de rgyu gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement I will go to Sudasaputra is made for two reasons.

original: legs par bshad pa la mchod pa'i tshad kyi tshig dang / bdag nyid 'byor ba'i don las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa la mchod pa'i tshad kyi tshig dang / bdag nyid 'byor ba'i don las ldog pa'o //
translated: The verse on the measure of worship of good advice, and the reversal of the meaning of one's own wealth.

original: mi dga' ba las brtsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dga' ba las brtsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to seek out what is unpleasant,

original: ci ste bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is for the sake of protecting the truth,

original: bdag nyid la mi dga' ba mi bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bu khyod nyid la phan pa'i phyir zhas bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la mi dga' ba mi bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bu khyod nyid la phan pa'i phyir zhas bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: With regard to not being displeased with oneself, it says for the sake of your own benefit, O son, and so on.

original: bden pa bsrung ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bden pa bsrung ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to protecting the truth,

original: 'on te de'i drung du 'gro bar khyod kyis khas blangs te //
analyzed: 'on te de'i drung du 'gro bar khyod kyis khas blangs te //
translated: If you have promised to go before him,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gzhung lugs kyi chos dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi chos yin pas gzhung lugs kyi chos so //
analyzed: gzhung lugs kyi chos dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi chos yin pas gzhung lugs kyi chos so //
translated: The Dharma that contradicts the scriptural tradition is the Dharma of the sages, so it is the Dharma of the scriptural tradition.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni gzhung lugs kyi chos dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni gzhung lugs kyi chos dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The Dharma that contradicts that is the Dharma that contradicts the scriptural tradition.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying bzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying bzhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for sinking in the mud of suffering,

original: mi'i sha za ba'i sdug bsngal ba nyid du bying ba'o //
analyzed: mi'i sha za ba'i sdug bsngal ba nyid du bying ba'o //
translated: it is sinking in the suffering of eating human flesh.

original: sems can dmyal ba la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “facing the hells” means

original: dmyal bar skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmyal bar skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
translated: that they are facing the birth of a hell being.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying ba'i phyir te /
translated: they are sinking in the mud of suffering.

original: de ltar 'di gnyis kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to /
analyzed: de ltar 'di gnyis kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to /
translated: Thus, these two lines show that they are suffering.

original: mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes kyis yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes kyis yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “abandoned by friends and relatives” means

original: bzod pa'i 'bras bu g-yog 'khor gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i 'bras bu g-yog 'khor gyis yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: that they are abandoned by their retinue, which is the result of their lack of patience.

original: mgon ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang sdang ma mthong @331b ba'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su spangs pa ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgon ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang sdang ma mthong @331b ba'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su spangs pa ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “without a protector” means that they are abandoned by other people who see that they are hostile, because they are useless.

original: de'i drin gyis zhes bya ba ni btang ba'i rgyus so //
analyzed: de'i drin gyis zhes bya ba ni btang ba'i rgyus so //
translated: The phrase “through their kindness” means through the cause of their abandonment.

original: yun ring du goms pa des sems shin tu rtsub cing dri ma shas cher yog pa gang la yod pa de ni sems rtsub pa yun ring du goms pa'i dri mas shas cher yog pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring du goms pa des sems shin tu rtsub cing dri ma shas cher yog pa gang la yod pa de ni sems rtsub pa yun ring du goms pa'i dri mas shas cher yog pa'o //
translated: The phrase “their minds are covered by the stain of long-standing, deep-seated hostility” means that their minds are very rough and covered by a great deal of the stain of hostility, because they have long been accustomed to it.

original: 'jigs pa dang skrag pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir brtan pas bdag rang 'dir 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang skrag pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir brtan pas bdag rang 'dir 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: I have come here myself, because I am steadfast, having no fear or anxiety whatsoever.

original: de bas na bden pa smra zhing dge ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na bden pa smra zhing dge ba'o //
translated: Therefore, I am one who speaks the truth and is virtuous.

original: bden pa smra zhes grags pa de ji lta bu'i bden pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa smra zhes grags pa de ji lta bu'i bden pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is one who speaks the truth, abiding in truth?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di ltar bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because he protects the truth,

original: srog dang rgyal srid gang gtong ba //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srog dang rgyal srid gang gtong ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he gives up his life and kingdom.

original: gzi byin rab tu nyams zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gzi byin rab tu nyams zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
translated: By this, he shows that it is the result of suffering in a future world.

original: 'phral gyi bden pa mi 'grub pa //
analyzed: 'phral gyi bden pa mi 'grub pa //
translated: He does not achieve immediate truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bden pa yang mi 'grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bden pa yang mi 'grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that he does not even achieve the truth of the present life.

original: 'on kyang khyod ni 'jig rten gnyi ga la phan ba sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod ni 'jig rten gnyi ga la phan ba sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: However, you do not accomplish what is beneficial for both worlds.

original: gzhung lugs kyi tshul la ni nga nyid mkhas so //
analyzed: gzhung lugs kyi tshul la ni nga nyid mkhas so //
translated: I am skilled in the rules of scripture.

original: chos kyi gzi phyin rab tu nyams so zhes bya ba des ni ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi gzi phyin rab tu nyams so zhes bya ba des ni ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzhung lugs tshul spyod ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad brtsams so //
analyzed: gzhung lugs tshul spyod ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad brtsams so //
translated: The treatise on ethics is composed.

original: shi nas ni ngan song du ltung ba yin te /
analyzed: shi nas ni ngan song du ltung ba yin te /
translated: After death, one falls into the lower realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi gzi byin nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi gzi byin nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the splendor of the Dharma is lost.

original: brdzun smra btang nas bden pa nga smra ste //
analyzed: brdzun smra btang nas bden pa nga smra ste //
translated: Abandoning false speech, I speak the truth.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni sngar bstan pa'i don sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni sngar bstan pa'i don sdud pa yin te /
translated: This verse summarizes the meaning taught above.

original: de bas shes zhes bya ba spyod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de bas shes zhes bya ba spyod par gyur na ni /
translated: Therefore, if one acts with knowledge,

original: chos kyi gzi byin nyams pa dang / 'phral gyi bde ba mi 'grub pa dang / shi nas ngan song du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi gzi byin nyams pa dang / 'phral gyi bde ba mi 'grub pa dang / shi nas ngan song du 'gro ba ste /
translated: the splendor of the Dharma is lost, immediate happiness is not accomplished, and after death one goes to the lower realms.

original: de bas na nyes ba dag gis mi rung ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na nyes ba dag gis mi rung ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the unsuitability of those faults,

original: yongs su dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dor bar bya'o //
translated: one should completely abandon them.

original: mkhas smra ba zhes bya ba ni lugs kyi bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas smra ba zhes bya ba ni lugs kyi bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skillful speech means being skilled in the treatises on ethics.

original: grags dang bde ba'i don dang 'gal ba gang //
analyzed: grags dang bde ba'i don dang 'gal ba gang //
translated: What is contrary to the purpose of fame and happiness?

original: zhes bya ba la grags pa smos pas ni mkhas pa ni mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la grags pa smos pas ni mkhas pa ni mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By mentioning fame, he refers to the wise, who are worthy of worship.

original: bde ba smos pas ni 'dod pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba smos pas ni 'dod pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning happiness, he refers to the sense objects.

original: re zhig 'dis ci dang 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig 'dis ci dang 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is contrary to these?

original: mthun pa drug gang bstan pa de ston pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa drug gang bstan pa de ston pa yin te /
translated: He shows that it is the six faults that are taught.

original: 'gal ba'i don dang / gnod pa dang / mthun pa'i don dang / 'gal ba'i gnod pa dang / don dang mthun pa'i gnod pa dang / 'di bzhi ni gzhung bzang po zhes mkhas pa mi smra ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don dang / gnod pa dang / mthun pa'i don dang / 'gal ba'i gnod pa dang / don dang mthun pa'i gnod pa dang / 'di bzhi ni gzhung bzang po zhes mkhas pa mi smra ste /
translated: The wise do not speak of the four: the meaning that is contrary, the harm that is contrary, the meaning that is consistent, and the harm that is consistent with the meaning.

original: de ltar don dang rjes su mthun pa dang / @332a * //
analyzed: de ltar don dang rjes su mthun pa dang / @332a * //
translated: Thus, one should be consistent with the meaning

original: gnod pa don dang rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / dang du len par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa don dang rjes su mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / dang du len par gyur pa yin te /
translated: and consistent with the harm.

original: des na phangs pa'i srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: des na phangs pa'i srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he composed the verse beginning with dear life.

original: phangs pa'i srog ces bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu yongs su spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: phangs pa'i srog ces bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu yongs su spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This line the life that is so dear shows the abandonment of the result of morality.

original: nang mi mchi mas 'ju ba zhes bya bas ni bzod pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nang mi mchi mas 'ju ba zhes bya bas ni bzod pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The line the inner sorrow shows the abandonment of the result of patience.

original: rgyal srid bde ba yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rgyal srid bde ba yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The line the delightful happiness of kingship shows the abandonment of the result of generosity.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu gsum po yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu gsum po yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, he shows the abandonment of the three results of the accumulation of merit.

original: don 'di ji ltar don dang mthun par 'gyur //
analyzed: don 'di ji ltar don dang mthun par 'gyur //
translated: How can this be consistent with the meaning?

original: zhes 'dri ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'dri ba yin te /
translated: This is the question.

original: don du 'gyur ba ci mthong na //
analyzed: don du 'gyur ba ci mthong na //
translated: What benefit do you see in it?

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar mkhas pas srog yongs su gtong ba'o //🔽bden pa'i tshig ces bya ba de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar mkhas pas srog yongs su gtong ba'o // bden pa'i tshig ces bya ba de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows how the wise give up their lives.

original: de bsrung phyir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bsrung phyir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to establish just this, he says, For the sake of protecting that . . .

original: de bsrung phyir ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsrung phyir ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “In order to protect that” means in order to protect the truth.

original: drung du 'ongs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: drung du 'ongs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Approached” means

original: de ltar gcig pu phub dang mtshon cha med par ro //
analyzed: de ltar gcig pu phub dang mtshon cha med par ro //
translated: in that way, alone, without armor or weapons.

original: nga'i zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba btang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba btang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “My” refers to the one who is to be killed, the one who is released, and so on.

original: phreng ba mdzes pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyi phyed ni longs spyod pa rnams kyi yid du 'ong ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: phreng ba mdzes pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyi phyed ni longs spyod pa rnams kyi yid du 'ong ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The first half of the verse “The beautiful garland” is from the perspective of the pleasant enjoyments.

original: bsod nams kyi yon tan yin pas bsod nams yon tan no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi yon tan yin pas bsod nams yon tan no //
translated: Since it is the quality of merit, it is merit-quality.

original: de 'grub pa ni bsod nams yon tan 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de 'grub pa ni bsod nams yon tan 'grub pa ste /
translated: Its accomplishment is the accomplishment of merit-quality.

original: bsod nams yon tan 'grub pa des khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams yon tan 'grub pa des khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is distinguished by that accomplishment of merit-quality.

original: nyon mongs pa med par zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngal ba med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngal ba med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Without affliction” means without physical fatigue.

original: dka' thub ni gang gi phyir yon tan 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dka' thub ni gang gi phyir yon tan 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Asceticism is the characteristic of increasing qualities.

original: mu stegs 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni stegs la brten nas bsod nams rab tu 'grub cing /🔽ngan par spyod pa dag la yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni stegs la brten nas bsod nams rab tu 'grub cing / ngan par spyod pa dag la yin te /
translated: The term going to the tirthas refers to the tirthas, which are places where merit is well established and where bad conduct is absent.

original: stegs dag tu 'gro ba'i nyon mongs med par bsod nams thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stegs dag tu 'gro ba'i nyon mongs med par bsod nams thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The term going to the tirthas means that one obtains merit without affliction.

original: 'dis ni sngar bsags pa'i sdig pa bden pa nyid kyis dag par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sngar bsags pa'i sdig pa bden pa nyid kyis dag par bstan te /
translated: This shows that one purifies previously accumulated evil by the truth.

original: dka' thub spyod pa dang / mu stegs su spyod pa 'di gnyis kyis bsod nams dang yon tan 'grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dka' thub spyod pa dang / mu stegs su spyod pa 'di gnyis kyis bsod nams dang yon tan 'grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that both the practice of austerities and the practice of going to the tirthas are the means of accomplishing merit and good qualities.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag khyab pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag khyab pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This verse on the supremacy of faith refers to the results in the present life, high status and definite goodness.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag khyad par 'phel ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag khyad par 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag khyad par 'phel ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag khyad par 'phel ba'o //
translated: The phrase the increase of the whole world means the increase of the whole world.

original: 'jig rten gsum las @332b 'da' ba'i zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng dang / nam mkha' dang / mtho ris te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las @332b 'da' ba'i zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng dang / nam mkha' dang / mtho ris te /
translated: The path that transcends the three worlds means the earth, the sky, and heaven.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig rten gsum las 'da' ba'i lam ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig rten gsum las 'da' ba'i lam ni bde ba ste /
translated: The path that transcends such a world is happiness.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: This shows the result in this life.

original: lha'i gnas su 'dzug pa'i sgo yang yin //
analyzed: lha'i gnas su 'dzug pa'i sgo yang yin //
translated: It is the door that leads to the heavenly realms.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bden pa mngon par mtho ba'i lam nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bden pa mngon par mtho ba'i lam nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the path to the higher realms.

original: 'khor ba'i rdzong las thar ba'i zam pa yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rdzong las thar ba'i zam pa yin //
translated: It is the bridge that leads to freedom from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par legs pa'i lam nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par legs pa'i lam nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the path to definite goodness.

original: lha yis rab tu bsgribs kyang gnas mi nus //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni bcos su mi nus pa'i phyir /🔽'chi bas 'jigs pa med do zhes bya ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o ;
analyzed: lha yis rab tu bsgribs kyang gnas mi nus // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni bcos su mi nus pa'i phyir / 'chi bas 'jigs pa med do zhes bya ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o ;
translated: Even if the gods try to block it, they cannot.🔽 This verse shows that there is no fear of death because it cannot be averted.

original: / de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba bcos su med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: / de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba bcos su med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus means because of the inevitability of death.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi chos nyid la brtags na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi chos nyid la brtags na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The line when one examines the nature of worldly things is the answer.

original: sdig pa byas pas rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa byas pas rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur //
translated: One will regret having done evil.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni ldog pa med pa dang 'jug pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni ldog pa med pa dang 'jug pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This verse shows the absence of both the way of turning away and the way of engaging.

original: sdig pa byas na rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa byas na rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur //
translated: One will regret having done evil.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa'i tshul med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa'i tshul med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows the absence of the way of turning away.

original: dge ba'i las kyang legs par yongs ma byas //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyang legs par yongs ma byas //
translated: One will regret not having done good.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jug pa'i tshul med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jug pa'i tshul med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows the absence of the way of engaging.

original: phyi ma'i tshe la sdug bsngal 'byung du dogs //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshe la sdug bsngal 'byung du dogs //
translated: One fears that suffering will arise in future lives.

original: zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka'i tshul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka'i tshul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no way of either of those two.

original: gang las bdag gi yid ni 'gyod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang las bdag gi yid ni 'gyod 'gyur ba //
translated: I have no regret in my mind.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis bdag ni de gnyi ga'i don gyi tshul med pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis bdag ni de gnyi ga'i don gyi tshul med pa yin te /
translated: This verse shows that I have no way of either of those two.

original: des na 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I have no fear of death.

original: phongs pa rnams ni slong du 'ongs pa la //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams ni slong du 'ongs pa la //
translated: The poor, when they come to beg,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni bstan ma thag pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni bstan ma thag pa /
translated: This verse shows the immediately preceding

original: dkar po'i las kyang rab tu goms byas pa //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dkar po'i las kyang rab tu goms byas pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And also well practiced in virtue,

original: dkar po'i chos byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has done virtuous things.

original: chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show abiding in the Dharma,

original: mgu ba rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mgu ba rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he says he finds satisfaction.

original: slong du 'ongs pa la nor thob pas mgu ba yin te /
analyzed: slong du 'ongs pa la nor thob pas mgu ba yin te /
translated: When the poor come to beg, he is satisfied by the acquisition of wealth.

original: phongs pa rnams mi mgu bar byas pa ni med de ma dran pa'o //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams mi mgu bar byas pa ni med de ma dran pa'o //
translated: He does not make the poor dissatisfied, he does not remember.

original: bdag gis byas par yang mi dran zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gis byas par yang mi dran zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: What is it that he does not remember? In order to show that, he says:

original: ring du brtags te bsams kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: ring du brtags te bsams kyang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Even when he examines for a long time,

original: sdig pa byas par yongs mi dran //
analyzed: sdig pa byas par yongs mi dran //
translated: He does not remember any evil he has done.

original: zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Evil refers to killing and so on.

original: yid la bsams ba tsam yang zhes bya ba ni yod par bkod pa yin pas yid la bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yid la bsams ba tsam yang zhes bya ba ni yod par bkod pa yin pas yid la bsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase not even a thought means that he did not even think of them, that is, he did not consider them.

original: yang na yid nyid @333a * //
analyzed: yang na yid nyid @333a * //
translated: Or, thought means mind.

original: bsams pa yin pas yid la bsams pa ste /
analyzed: bsams pa yin pas yid la bsams pa ste /
translated: Therefore, thought means mind.

original: sems bskyed pa tsam yang ma dran no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tsam yang ma dran no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that he did not even remember the mere thought of them.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa gang yin pa de ni mtho ris lam sbyangs so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa gang yin pa de ni mtho ris lam sbyangs so //
translated: Thus, he trained in the path to heaven in two ways.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyis chos la 'jug pa dang / sdig pa las ldog pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyis chos la 'jug pa dang / sdig pa las ldog pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the method of engaging in virtue and turning away from sin.

original: phongs pa rnams ni slong du 'ongs pa la /
analyzed: phongs pa rnams ni slong du 'ongs pa la /
translated: When the poor came to beg,

original: mgu bar ma byas pa ni yongs mi dran //
analyzed: mgu bar ma byas pa ni yongs mi dran //
translated: he did not turn them away without satisfying them.

original: zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la /
translated: This is taught by the verse.

original: phongs pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: phongs pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the poor?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bram ze rnams dang gnyen dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: bram ze rnams dang gnyen dang zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Brahmins, relatives, and friends.

original: de la bram ze zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: de la bram ze zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi zhing ngo //
translated: Here, brahmins are the field of virtues.

original: gnyen dang mdza' bo zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: gnyen dang mdza' bo zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ngo //
translated: The phrase friends and loved ones refers to the field of those who are helpful.

original: brten pa dang phongs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: brten pa dang phongs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i zhing ngo //
translated: The phrase those in need refers to the field of compassion.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs mgu bar byed pa yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs mgu bar byed pa yin zhe na / de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: How does the bodhisattva please those who are helpful?

original: de dag la nor mang po bzhag cing ji ltar 'os pa'i sbyin pas phongs pa rnams mgu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la nor mang po bzhag cing ji ltar 'os pa'i sbyin pas phongs pa rnams mgu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The root text states, By making gifts of wealth to them in abundance and in an appropriate manner, he or she satisfies those who are in need.

original: yang na nor shin tu mang po ci rigs par sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na nor shin tu mang po ci rigs par sbyin pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase can be interpreted to mean that he or she makes gifts of wealth in abundance and in an appropriate manner.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang gnyi ga yang dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang gnyi ga yang dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because both the bodhisattva and the other person are pleased.

original: gang gi bya ba ci yod de yang bdag gis byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kyang rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi bya ba ci yod de yang bdag gis byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kyang rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase Whatever needs to be done by them, he or she does it himself or herself refers to the act of instructing others.

original: nga mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa'i phyir dang / mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa'i phyir dang / mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase I am fearless means that he or she is fearless because he or she is established in the Dharma and because he or she has trained in the path to heaven.

original: de byas dga' bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa dga' ba thob pa'i phyir dang / mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byas dga' bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni chos la gnas pa dga' ba thob pa'i phyir dang / mtho ris kyi lam sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase and thus become joyful means that one attains joy by abiding in the Dharma and by training in the path to heaven.

original: yang na bram ze la sogs pa nor mang po bzhag pa'i phyir dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bram ze la sogs pa nor mang po bzhag pa'i phyir dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, one becomes joyful because one has established many brahmins and so on in wealth.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis dga' ba yin no //
translated: Joy is due to these two causes.

original: bdag gi spyod pa ni bdag gi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa ni bdag gi spyod pa'o //
translated: One's own behavior is one's own conduct.

original: bdag gi spyod pa nyid gzugs yin pas bdag gi spyod pa'i gzugs te ngan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa nyid gzugs yin pas bdag gi spyod pa'i gzugs te ngan pa'o //
translated: The form of one's own conduct is one's own conduct-form.

original: de ni de lta bu'i chos kyi me long la'o //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i chos kyi me long la'o //
translated: One should look at that in a mirror of Dharma.

original: dga' dang ldan pa'i mig gis lta //
analyzed: dga' dang ldan pa'i mig gis lta //
translated: One should look with an eye of joy.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos 'chad pa la gus pa dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos 'chad pa la gus pa dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that one should be full of devotion to the Dharma teacher.

original: gal te sha med na 'tsho bar mi nus na ni sha'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: gal te sha med na 'tsho bar mi nus na ni sha'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: If one cannot live without meat, then in order to show the way of meat,

original: sman pa mkhas pas brtags te zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pas brtags te zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse “Having examined by a skilled physician” is stated.

original: sman pas brtags pa ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: sman pas brtags pa ni phan pa'o //
translated: The examination by a physician is beneficial.

original: legs par sbyar ba'i sha zhes bya ba ni sman pas legs par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: legs par sbyar ba'i sha zhes bya ba ni sman pas legs par brtags pa ste /
translated: The phrase “meat that is well prepared” means that it is well examined by a physician.

original: 'dis ni g-yos kyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni g-yos kyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the difference in cooking.

original: gnas rnams bzhi las skyes pa'i sha bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas rnams bzhi las skyes pa'i sha bstan pa yin te /
translated: It shows the meat that arises from the four places.

original: dus ji lta ba dang / nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du sman pas na ba nyid du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba dang / nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du sman pas na ba nyid du sbyar ro //
translated: The physician should prepare it according to the time and according to the disease.

original: de ltar re zhig yid du 'ong zhing 'dod pa'i sha rnyed cing 'grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yid du 'ong zhing 'dod pa'i sha rnyed cing 'grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that one obtains and accomplishes the meat that is desirable and pleasing,

original: gzhan yang bde ba thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rnga sgra snyan pa dbyar gyi 'brug sgra bzhin du sgrogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rnga sgra snyan pa dbyar gyi 'brug sgra bzhin du sgrogs //
translated: in order to show that one also obtains happiness,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse “Having beaten the drum of Dharma, which is like the pleasant sound of a drum, like the thunder of summer” is stated.

original: rnga sgra snyan pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed dang pos ni /
analyzed: rnga sgra snyan pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed dang pos ni /
translated: The first half of the verse beginning “The sweet sound of the drum”

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'i phan yon yongs su btang ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'i phan yon yongs su btang ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: teaches the benefit of great wealth as the result of generosity.

original: gnyen dang / bu dang / nang mi zhes bye ba phyed 'og mas ni /
analyzed: gnyen dang / bu dang / nang mi zhes bye ba phyed 'og mas ni /
translated: The second half beginning “Friends, sons, and relatives”

original: bzod pa'i 'bras bu g-yog 'khor mang pos phan yon yongs su btang ba bstan to //
analyzed: bzod pa'i 'bras bu g-yog 'khor mang pos phan yon yongs su btang ba bstan to //
translated: teaches the benefit of a large retinue as the result of patience.

original: dgag par bya ba dang / dgag pa la sbyar @336b zhing dbang bya ba de gnyis kyi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba dang / dgag pa la sbyar @336b zhing dbang bya ba de gnyis kyi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the two, the object of negation and the application of the negation,

original: rgyal po'i sems kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i sems kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: the king’s mind is the dominant condition.

original: rgyal po'i sems kyi dbang du 'gro ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i sems kyi dbang du 'gro ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right for the king’s mind to be the dominant condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi rol gyi stobs dang ldan pa las kyang rgyal bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi stobs dang ldan pa las kyang rgyal bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is possible to be victorious even over external powerful ones.

original: nang gi bde ba ni tshar bcad cing rgyal bar bya ba de la sdang bar bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: nang gi bde ba ni tshar bcad cing rgyal bar bya ba de la sdang bar bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right to be hostile to that which is to be defeated and conquered, the internal happiness.

original: chos dang / srid la mi gnod pa'i lam du 'jug par rigs te /
analyzed: chos dang / srid la mi gnod pa'i lam du 'jug par rigs te /
translated: It is proper to enter a path that does not harm Dharma and the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽In order to teach its cause,

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the verse,

original: mi yi bdag po 'jig rten phyi ma'ang //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po 'jig rten phyi ma'ang //
translated: The lord of men should also look to the next world,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: was stated.

original: chos dang srid la mi gnod lam la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang srid la mi gnod lam la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “entering a path that does not harm Dharma and the world”?

original: 'jig rten pha rol la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it looks to the next world.

original: chos dang / srid la mi gnod pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang / srid la mi gnod pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that which does not harm Dharma and the world?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chos dang srid la gnod pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽de bas 'ga' yang phan ba ma yin bstan mi rigs //
analyzed: chos dang srid la gnod pa'i dbang du byas nas / de bas 'ga' yang phan ba ma yin bstan mi rigs //
translated: Considering that which harms Dharma and the world,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: it is not proper to teach that which is not beneficial to anyone.

original: gang chos dang / srid la gnod pa ma yin pa'i lam de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: gang chos dang / srid la gnod pa ma yin pa'i lam de nyid smras pa /
translated: That very path which does not harm Dharma and the world is stated:

original: lam gang yid du 'ong la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad byed 'og ma'o //
analyzed: lam gang yid du 'ong la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad byed 'og ma'o //
translated: The verse, “The path that is pleasant,” is the next verse.

original: grags dang mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i grags pa dang mi 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: grags dang mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i grags pa dang mi 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of “not opposed to what is renowned”?

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: He himself says:

original: lam gang yid du 'ong la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam gang yid du 'ong la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The path that is agreeable”

original: dam pa rnams bzhed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam pa rnams bzhed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that which is accepted by the holy ones.

original: ji ltar mi dga' ba yin na yang phan pa'i sman ni nad pas btung bar bya ba de bzhin du bsten pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi dga' ba yin na yang phan pa'i sman ni nad pas btung bar bya ba de bzhin du bsten pa'i rigs so //
translated: Just as a sick person should drink a medicine that is disagreeable but beneficial, so it is proper to rely on the path.

original: rgyu'i skabs su gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i skabs su gnas pa ste /
translated: This is the section on the cause.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽grags pa'i rgyu yis 'gro ba 'di dag khyab //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / grags pa'i rgyu yis 'gro ba 'di dag khyab //
translated: How is it so?

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: “The world is pervaded by the cause of what is renowned.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'di ltar gang gis sdig pa spyod pa de ni 'di ltar sdig pa spyod pa de'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis sdig pa spyod pa de ni 'di ltar sdig pa spyod pa de'o //
translated: It is like this: Whoever engages in evil, that one engages in evil.

original: sdig pa spyod pa'i 'chi bdag gi pho nya gang yin pa de ni 'chi bdag pho nyar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa spyod pa'i 'chi bdag gi pho nya gang yin pa de ni 'chi bdag pho nyar gyur pa ste /
translated: The messengers of the Lord of Death for one who engages in evil are the messengers of the Lord of Death.

original: sdig pa spyod pa'i khyad par 'dis so //
analyzed: sdig pa spyod pa'i khyad par 'dis so //
translated: This is the distinction of one who engages in evil.

original: bdag la ji ltar bka' stsal de bzhin bgyi //
analyzed: bdag la ji ltar bka' stsal de bzhin bgyi //
translated: “I will do just as you have instructed.”

original: zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa gzhan yang de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal pa gzhan yang de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the request.  I will do so is the reply.

original: btson rar stsal bas mi dga' zhing //🔽zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: btson rar stsal bas mi dga' zhing // zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: He is unhappy because he is put in prison.

original: bzhin mdangs nyams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi lus kyi gzi mdangs nyams par bstan to //
analyzed: bzhin mdangs nyams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi lus kyi gzi mdangs nyams par bstan to //
translated: His complexion is bad shows the bad color of his physical body.

original: mya ngan gdungs pa'i yid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mya ngan gdungs pa'i yid ces bya ba ni /
translated: His mind is tormented by grief.

original: mig gi sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mig gi sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: His eyes are full of tears shows the suffering of his eyes.

original: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las bu zla ba'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las bu zla ba'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This completes the life of Candra, the son, from the commentary on the Acts of the Buddha called the Sanskrit commentary by Acharya Haribhadra.

original: // / @337a * //  legs pa'i lam ni thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: // / @337a * //  legs pa'i lam ni thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: The good path is the path of liberation.

original: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la 'dir stsogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la 'dir stsogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: Aging, sickness, death, and separation from what is dear.  Here, by mentioning and so on,

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires despite searching for it, and so on are included.

original: mgon med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal zhing 'dod pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid sdug bsngal zhing 'dod pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase those who have no protector refers to those who are devoid of a protector who is able to rescue them.

original: de med pa'o //🔽skyabs med pa zhes bya ba ni skyob par byed pa bdag nyid la med pa ste /🔽'di ni skyabs med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'o // skyabs med pa zhes bya ba ni skyob par byed pa bdag nyid la med pa ste / 'di ni skyabs med pa'o //
translated: They are without a protector because they are devoid of such a protector.

original: dpung gnyen med pa zhes bya ba ni bde legs su yul dag tu phyin par byed pa /🔽byang chub sems las gzhan med pa ste /
analyzed: dpung gnyen med pa zhes bya ba ni bde legs su yul dag tu phyin par byed pa / byang chub sems las gzhan med pa ste /
translated: The phrase those who have no ally refers to those who are devoid of an ally who is able to bring about their welfare.🔽They are without an ally because they are devoid of such an ally.

original: rgyu de gsum med par bstan to //🔽snying rjes bskul te zhes bya ba ni de ltar mgon med pa la bdag nyid mgon du khas len pa bstan to //🔽de dag bskyab par sems ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu de gsum med par bstan to // snying rjes bskul te zhes bya ba ni de ltar mgon med pa la bdag nyid mgon du khas len pa bstan to // de dag bskyab par sems ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase those who have no other recourse refers to those who are devoid of a third recourse.🔽The phrase those who have no other hope refers to those who are devoid of a fourth hope.🔽The phrase those who have no other refuge refers to those who are devoid of a fifth refuge.🔽The phrase those who have no other place to go refers to those who are devoid of a sixth place to go.🔽The phrase those who have no other savior refers to those who are devoid of a seventh savior.🔽The phrase those who have no other support refers to those who are devoid of an eighth support.🔽The phrase those who have no other resort refers to those who are devoid of a ninth resort.🔽The phrase those who have no other destination refers to those who are devoid of a tenth destination.🔽The phrase those who have no other hope refers to those who are devoid of an eleventh hope.🔽The phrase those who have no other refuge refers to those who are devoid of a twelfth refuge.🔽The phrase those who have no other place to go refers to those who are devoid of a thirteenth place to go.🔽The phrase those who have no other savior refers to those who are devoid of a fourteenth savior.🔽The phrase those who have no other support refers to those who are devoid of a fifteenth support.

original: de ltar skyabs med pa dag la bdag nyid bskyab par sems pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de ltar skyabs med pa dag la bdag nyid bskyab par sems pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The phrase those who have no other resort refers to those who are devoid of a sixteenth resort.🔽The phrase those who have no other destination refers to those who are devoid of a seventeenth destination.🔽The phrase those who have no other hope refers to those who are devoid of an eighteenth

original: rab tu dge ba'i rang bzhin can de bsgrub par 'dod pa'i yid ces bya ba ni dpung gnyen med pa'i 'jig rten la bdag nyid dpung gnyen byed pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rab tu dge ba'i rang bzhin can de bsgrub par 'dod pa'i yid ces bya ba ni dpung gnyen med pa'i 'jig rten la bdag nyid dpung gnyen byed pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The phrase “the mind that wishes to accomplish that which is extremely virtuous” shows that one’s own self is the protector for the world that has no protector.

original: 'dis ni gsum po de dag gi khyad par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gsum po de dag gi khyad par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the difference between the three.

original: mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa dag gi khyad par du gtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa dag gi khyad par du gtogs par bya ste /
translated: The difference is that the first is for those who have no protector, the second is for those who have no refuge, and the third is for those who have no ally.

original: snying rjes bskul ba'i phyir mgon no //
analyzed: snying rjes bskul ba'i phyir mgon no //
translated: He is a protector because he is urged on by compassion.

original: de dag bskyab par sems pa'i phyir skyabs so //
analyzed: de dag bskyab par sems pa'i phyir skyabs so //
translated: He is a refuge because he is intent on protecting them.

original: rab tu dge pa'i rang bzhin can de phan pa dang / bde ba'i khyad par can zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpung gnyen no //
analyzed: rab tu dge pa'i rang bzhin can de phan pa dang / bde ba'i khyad par can zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpung gnyen no //
translated: He is an ally because he is the one who has the nature of what is extremely virtuous and who brings about the distinction of benefit and happiness.

original: rgyu 'di gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu 'di gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he possesses these three causes,

original: sdug bsngal las skyob pa nyid kyis phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las skyob pa nyid kyis phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa nyid du ston to //
translated: he is shown to be the one who brings about benefit and happiness by protecting from suffering.

original: de bzhin du gzhan 'das pa gang dang gang dag tu tshig gsum po 'di bstan pa de dang de dag tu yang 'di bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan 'das pa gang dang gang dag tu tshig gsum po 'di bstan pa de dang de dag tu yang 'di bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in whatever other past lives these three phrases were taught, they should be understood in this way.

original: 'bangs rnams glo ba nye pa'i bde ba dang 'khrug pa med pa'i dar ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi yul gyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bangs rnams glo ba nye pa'i bde ba dang 'khrug pa med pa'i dar ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi yul gyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By the happiness of the people being close to his heart, and the prosperity of his country being free from disturbance, he shows the excellence of his own country.

original: rgyal phran thams cad kyi dregs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyal phran thams cad kyi dregs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal phran thams cad kyi dregs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyal phran thams cad kyi dregs pa'o //
translated: The pride of all the vassal kings is the pride of all the vassal kings.

original: de rnams phyag 'tshal ba ni rgyal phran dregs pa rnams phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams phyag 'tshal ba ni rgyal phran dregs pa rnams phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Their bowing is the bowing of the proud vassal kings.

original: 'dis ni yul gzhan du gyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul gzhan du gyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of other countries.

original: dul ba la dga' bas zhes bya bas ma 'ongs @337b pa'i 'bras bu rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dul ba la dga' bas zhes bya bas ma 'ongs @337b pa'i 'bras bu rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By delighting in discipline, he shows the excellence of the future effect, the cause.

original: rgyal po'i rigs de dang de dag bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rigs de dang de dag bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The happiness and suffering of those royal families are the happiness and suffering of those royal families.

original: de'i bde ba sdug bsngal mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bde ba sdug bsngal mnyam pa'o //
translated: The pleasure of that is equal to the pain.

original: sbyin pa thob pas bram ze mgu zhing g-yengs //
analyzed: sbyin pa thob pas bram ze mgu zhing g-yengs //
translated: The brahmin is pleased and delighted by the gift.

original: zhes bya ba ni phongs pa'i skye bo mgu ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phongs pa'i skye bo mgu ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o//
translated: This is in terms of the perfection of pleasing the poor.

original: 'bangs rnams dregs pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'bangs rnams dregs pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The people are haughty, and so on up to🔽the sweet sounds of song and dance.

original: glu sgra snyan pa dgod pas zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nye bar longs spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: glu sgra snyan pa dgod pas zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nye bar longs spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of enjoyment.

original: gcig la gcig 'jus dga' ba rnams par 'phel //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'jus dga' ba rnams par 'phel //
translated: They are mutually affectionate and their joy increases.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang phrad pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang phrad pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of the pleasure of being with what is dear.

original: gtam snyan skyel ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'og ma phyed 'dis ni gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba de'i gnyen po bde ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gtam snyan skyel ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'og ma phyed 'dis ni gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba de'i gnyen po bde ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The second half of the next verse shows the perfection of the side of pleasure that is the antidote to the suffering of not getting what one wants.

original: sgo rnams phye zhing btson du bzung ba med //
analyzed: sgo rnams phye zhing btson du bzung ba med //
translated: The gates are open and there are no prisoners.

original: ces bya bas ni bde ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya bas ni bde ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows the happiness.

original: srang gi bzhi mdo rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni grong khyer gyi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: srang gi bzhi mdo rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni grong khyer gyi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The statement about the crossroads, the crossroads of the city, etc. shows the excellence of the city's adornment.

original: khang pa chen po'i steng nas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni skye bo sbyin pa po'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //🔽snying stobs dang ldan pa dang / bsod nams bsags pa'i khyad par 'di gnyis kyis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: khang pa chen po'i steng nas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni skye bo sbyin pa po'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o // snying stobs dang ldan pa dang / bsod nams bsags pa'i khyad par 'di gnyis kyis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning from the top of the great palace is from the point of view of the excellence of the benefactor's practice.

original: ye shes dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: These two verses show the excellence of the cause, by the excellence of the cause of the two accumulations of wisdom and merit.

original: bsrung ba legs par byas pas zhes bya ba yin te /🔽yongs su gzung ba'i phyir re //
analyzed: bsrung ba legs par byas pas zhes bya ba yin te / yongs su gzung ba'i phyir re //
translated: Well-guarded means well-protected.🔽Well-protected means well-guarded.
